description:
I've never actually had coffee here, but this is my favorite place to get San Francisco made treats.  My old boss got our team little boxes of caramels several years ago and I was pretty much hooked ever since.  I recently bought boxes for 10 of my coworkers across the country and mailed them to everyone. Needless to say they were just as obsessed with those sea salt caramels as I am.  

Btw, if you want to buy these during the holiday season you should definitely pre-order.  It's highly unlikely they will be available to purchase in-store.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Yelp's search algorithm refuses to show this place in its dropdown menu of suggestions as soon as you finish typing the word "hooker." And yes, Hooker's Sweet Treats is smack dab in the heart of the Tenderloin, so what could possibly get more San Franciscan than that? 

While this infamously gritty neighborhood is a little rough around the edges, it has plenty of character. No, these aren't just any hooker's sweet treats you'll sample here. These are artisanal salted caramels that were clearly made with love and you'll sit at the communal table (found in every up-and-coming restaurant in San Francisco) and savor every single bite. 

Enjoy it while it lasts, because you'll only get two or three bites out of every caramel, which makes it hard for me to justify the price of these caramels. The flavor combination found in the dark chocolate, small pieces of pretzel, and rice cereal in the Party Girl Caramel was admittedly quite tasty, but none of the salted caramels really wowed me. This place reminds me of the pricey creative cookies you can find at Milk Bar in D.C. or New York that are unfortunately never really worth it. I think I'd much rather treat myself to a box of See's Candies to get more bang for my buck or resort to the discounted candy aisle at Walgreens the day after Halloween...
author: Amy C.

description: Love love LOVE this place!!!! Hook is the best. Excellent treats for family and friends! My clients love these so much it's now expected whenever we meet....
author: Anne L.

description:
Mastery of excellence. 

Top tier. Some of the best caramel I've ever tasted. 3rd nut blew me away! Spectacularly delicious! Ideal presentation. A box of their sweet treats would make a great gift.
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
REVIEWER # 244

You would never know this place exist...well at least I didn't. It took a friend to tell me about this place and once he told me the name of the little joint I LOL'd! (Laughed out loud).
Yes, the name names me chuckle but the chocolate has me coming back for more!

DID YOU KNOW: That this store was on the cooking channel "Unique Sweets" and trust me when I say, the owner David, does make unique sweet treats.

Yup, you heard me right, David the owner is the one that makes these sweet treats sweet....Okay so that may be cheesy but you get the drift! The store has been around for 6 years! Wowzers! I would have never known since I have never heard of this little gem before.

They offer a handful of flavor combos but the base on them all is a salty buttery caramel that is both creamy, chewy and doesn't stick to your teeth. Seriously, how often do you find that? They have about6 or 7 flavor choices that all run $2 a pop and considering the size and handmade-ness of them all, it's pretty worth it. 

I was so impressed with the work that David does that I had to order the $20 box of 10 pieces of chocolates. 6 or 7 of those are specialty flavors and 4 are the original flavors.

Honestly I love all of them! They all have unique flavors and special names and I admit they are unique names as well such as:

-Party Girl Caramel-The sassy and spicy chocolate 
-Straight Boyfriend Caramel-The curious chocolate who really wants a little TLC. This chocolate consists of 3 types of chocolate, peanut butter cookie base, & candied peanuts. Yum
-The Towne S/more Caramel-Who has been around the block awhile! HAHA

OKAY...so you get the picture right? Very unique names they are!

There specialty includes: handmade salted caramels

The sweet that started it all: the OG, a buttery caramel encased in organic, fair-trade dark chocolate and dusted with smoked sea salt

My Recommendation of them all: the 3rd Nut caramel, an OG chock-full of almonds, cashews, and pecans

Other sweets that they sale in the store: strawberry-chocolate-chip bread pudding and caramel pralines, which 7x7 deemed one of the city's best cookies

Local retailers that sale Hooker's products: Sightglass Coffee, Rare Device, and Bi-Rite Market

BIG thanks to Daniel who was the cashier in the front and helped me with my order.

BIG SHOUT-OUT to David for making this delicious tasteful chocolates that will definitely keep me coming back for more!

Overall, I would definitely recommend this to all my friends especially the ones that are new to town. This is such a hidden gem that sales the BEST DANG CARAMEL CHOCOLATES. They make perfect gifts for birthdays, anniversaries or just to treat yourself.

Trust me you will have NO regrets!

REVIEW 63/196
author: Porsche C.

description:
This place is a golden gem in the TL inconspicuous. And amazing.  I love it

Amazing caramel Treats and odour in the. Morning. The bread pudding changes weekly and at delicious. 
Can't wait to come back every two weeks for a treat. So unique and delicious 
They also have day old discounts.
author: David C.

description: This is my go to spot for nice gifts.  I even run by here to grab boxes for sweets when I'm going out of town to bring as gifts.  Hooker's makes a superb product.
author: Pauline C.

description: Love Hooker's style...Adorable classy cool spot with an outstanding Americano, really friendly service & a fun theme. Another shining little gem in the TL.  The caramels are excellent the vibe is cool inside & I will definitely be back. Great spot for meeting someone.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
There were two customers in front of me. I was acknowledged and it didn't take long before I got to order a French press and their famous bread pudding. The coffee was $3 for and single about 12 oz. Bread pudding was delicious, $6. 

I noticed that there were many repeat customers that live around the neighborhood. I overheard the owner greeted the customer and said "will it be the usual" followed by his first name. That' excellent customer service and people will be back. 

I haven't tried their lattes or their caramels or bars but will get it next time I go. Their coffee is from Sightglass which is pretty popular in SF.
author: rod h.

description: I know a local business like this depends on good reviews but why would they have such bad customer service then? They gave me a lukewarm chai latte so I said something and the barista is like now you've taken a sip I can't make it hotter and I was like ok but it's cold. So he made me a new one and it was still lukewarm he was like is it better and I was like it's still kind of cold and he threw my money at me and said take your money. This never happens so I don't know what's wrong with you. It is not even tasty either. I'm sorry I did not bite my tongue and pretend to enjoy a lukewarm $5 chai latte but I chose to stick up for myself. And as a woman that probably pissed him off. Should have known with the misogynistic name.
author: Ashley U.

description:
Wednesday around 10am I was the only customer and bought a tidy box of the devil's desert that I'd sampled after forgetting about a Xmas gift of the stuff plus a coffee to go and 2 day old pastries about 27 bucks with tip.


I ate the box of chocolates over two days instead of sharing. Damn you. I'll try not to visit they have the correct ratio of salt to chocolate, I see red wine pairings the devil's haidmaiden ...
author: SF T.

description:
Amazing Chocolates / Scones and coffee. 
There owner Paul is very friendly and the other people working their are also.
Limited seating, Pet friendly for afew dogs at any one time only.
The assorted gift box of chocolates $20.00 for 10, were a huge hit for my peeps. Thank you!
author: Séamus C.

description:
Oh my goodness, best caramels ever! I was staying in the Tenderloin district for a conference and was so excited Hooker's Sweet Treats was only a few blocks from my hotel. Even if you are not in the area, you 100% need to make the trip over.

I was looking for a gift/souvenir for my husband and these caramels did the trick. The shop is very neat, warm and rustic and looks like it would be a great place to grab some coffee and relax. There are 7 types of caramels and they look and smell delicious. Because I couldn't decide, I bought the mixed box of 10. Each box is packed in front of you and beautifully wrapped in twine. 

My favorite was the original, which is their signature sea salt caramel covered in dark chocolate. Holy moly, probably the best candy/chocolate I have ever eaten, truly decadent and incredible. The box is $24 for 10, so pretty pricy, but worth it...take it as an investment in your happiness :) 

One regret....I wish I had bought more!! I will definitely be buying some online for holiday gifts and for diet splurging.
author: Vaish P.

description: I am addicted to these amazing creations. David and his crew work hard and it shows in the end result. Mouthwatering, sweet, delicious handmade caramels!! If I'm visiting friends out of town or state, this is my go to, unique SF gift to bring as a gift.
author: Kevin H.

description:
After a terrible disappointing visit to farm:table, I walked over to Hooker's Sweet Treats to try some of their bread pudding. I liked this place, not because it was anything special, but because the staff was friendly, the atmosphere was comfortable and the coffee was good. 

The bread pudding itself was decent, although it relied a bit too much on the caramel sauce and nuts as toppings to carry it. I've definitely had better bread pudding elsewhere.

Overall, if I were in the tenderloin for some reason and needed something sweet nearby, I might stop by here again. I wouldn't go out of my way for it though.
author: Mark O.

description:
These chocolate caramels are the best I've ever had!! The original is my favorite (caramel, sea salt and chocolate) however, I got the mix box of 10, it's a bit pricey but I think well worth it. I can't wait to try the rest of the flavors. 

The owner is really nice, we were the first customers at 8:30 am on a Tuesday which we enjoyed because it's a very small store. We were able to talk to the owner about the caramels, and the stores appearance on the cooking channel. The coffee was good and they also had some pastries that look delicious. 

I recommend Hookers on your list of culinary destinations in the city.
author: Natasha E.

description: Everything here is delicious from the cookies to the sweet treats to the bread pudding. Friendly faces greet you and are very helpful if you ask them about recommendations and such. The place is small but kept very neat and tidy and is kind of hidden in a part of the city that most people won't visit. Stop by if you have a sweet tooth, or not. Highly recommended!
author: SF N.

description: The best caramels in the US.   Amazing.   My go to for sending an amazing gift.   Everyone that received them loved them.  They usually end up ordering more.  They only ship at specific times of the year, so check the schedule.  Also if you want to get them around a holiday you will need to order early.   3rd nut caramels are my fav.  Order them, you will not be disappointed.
author: Cydney W.

description: The salted caramels are one of the most amazing treats you'll ever try!
author: Mabel Y.

description: What a cool neighborhood spot! I really enjoyed meeting David and Daniel and sampling the delicious bread pudding! On about a half-dozen occasions I have picked up a large box of the assorted hand-made caramels and taken them with me to share with coworkers, friends, and family and the delicious sweet treats were *always* well-received!
author: Lou S.

description:
Me: Sorry, couldn't think of what to get you for your birthday so I got you Hooker's. 

Bobby: uh ... come again?!!  0_o

For sweet beginnings and happy endings, give the 3rd nut and original Hooker caramels.

Best birthday surprise ever.
author: Janice C.

description: This is...THE BEST CHOCOLATE/CARAMEL....I've ever had. Oh my goodness. The caramel with a little bit of sea salt on top?! It's JUST the right amount of sweetness. Amazing.
author: Jessica M.

description: I went here a few months ago with some of my co-workers and I am still raving about it to everyone. These little caramel treats are to die for. My co-worker got the bread pudding and while I am not a bread pudding fan at all, Hooker's Sweet Treats bread pudding might have changed my mind. I got the sea salt caramel and if it wasn't so expensive per treat, I would've bought them all. Highly recommend!
author: Amanda N.

description: Very rich caramels; but oh so delicious! Especially love the white chocolate one and love the hint of salt!
author: Siv L.

description:
The caramel pecan seasalt bar is addictive! 

I ordered one planning to eat half, and save the other half to bring home for the husband. But it tasted so sweet, bitter, crunchy, and salty at the same time - that I finished the whole thing by myself. So I had to buy another one to take home for the husband. 

After dinner, he opened the bag, started eating that bar, and said "I'll just have a bite", I assumed he would save me a bite. But before I knew it, it was gone! Nothing was left, not even a crumb!

Evil! (The bar, not the husband)
author: Wendy K.

description: Love this little place! It's in my neighborhood and I stop in once in a great while, too much good stuff! I tried the sweet potato bread pudding, with salted caramel on top. Holy fuck balls, Batman! It was one of the best things I've ever shoved in my mouth. I'm a HUGE fan of bread pudding, and this one takes first place. Great customer service to go along with it. A must try!
author: Cesar R.

description: Our absolute favorite place for homemade Carmel's. Every place else never compares! A special gem of a place with great friendly staff too!
author: Karen S.

description:
I've been following Chef Matthew Pangelinan for several years now, the way one loyally follows anyone who is worthy of the effort. The hairstylist who gets it just right... the mechanic who is the only one who can keep your 300K mile German car purring like a kitten... the doctor who knows how to give you a shot without inducing winces that would make Dick Cheney uncomfortable... you drive a little further to stick with them. If you don't, you end up with a crooked bowl-cut, a broken-down car, and an injection site that looks like something out of Trainspotting.

This place, simply put, creates desserts that are fine enough for fancy occasions, accessible enough for everyday consumption. I'll even pop in for a latte and a caramel on a Saturday afternoon if I'm in the neighborhood. Absolutely delicious. Trust me, stop in for something sweet and something caffeinated... you'll never pop in to visit those hacks at Ghiardelli again...
author: Sean B.

description:
Really great place for coffee and a sweet bite. Dangerously close to my house though :) 

I stopped by for a cappuccino this afternoon. I was actually hoping to try their bread pudding or biscuits but they were out of biscuits (gotta go early for those) and the lemon/cherry bread pudding sounded a bit too daring for my taste buds. I did, however, get a peanut butter chocolate cookie which was AMAZING and tried a few of the salted caramels-all delicious. 

Great addition to the neighborhood and the people who work there seem nice/down to earth. It'll be my new coffee place/afternoon pick-me-up. The caramels also would make a great SF gift (they were making them fresh when I came in!).
author: Semuteh F.

description: I am not really a caramel person, but had read an enticing review that made me want to go here. When I arrived, there was a large chunk of 3rd Nut on the sampling plate. I also ordered the Happy Ending. I ate 3rd Nut first and loved it. It was the perfect balance of salty and sweet. The Happy Ending was nice, but I couldn't taste the orange essence, and the white chocolate was a little too much w.choc. Next I tried the original, but I didn't like it as much as 3rd Nut. Then I tried the S'more, which had a great blend of flavors. I returned today to buy a gift for someone, and look forward to getting more for myself another day.
author: Eva UnTiger S.

description: Got there around 10AM and were lucky to have our first pick of the caramels. We got three: the Original Hooker Caramel, the 3" Nut Caramel, and the Straight Boyfriend Caramel. We also bought a praline cookie. All were delicious, especially the 3" Nut and the Straight Boyfriend...totally worth a stop of you're in SF!
author: Sneha K.

description: I tried their chocolate caramels today which were fantastic!! The atmosphere was really cozy, and I got many photos inside there. I'll be right pretty soon!
author: Joel Y.

description:
Of the dozens of bakeries, cupcake shops and ice cream parlors I visited in my week-long quest for diabetes on my vacation to San Francisco, Hooker's is one of the few that is a MUST visit.

This awesome little coffee/sweet shop is located in the heart of the dilapidated Tenderloin neighborhood. Along with Brenda's, it is one of the few reasons that make it completely worth the trek through this shady, homeless infested neighborhood.

I don't know where to begin with how great this place is. Let's start with the most important part, the sweets.

We ate like it was our last meal ever, and not just the last day of our vacation, and ordered almost the entire menu. It was all well worth the accompanying sugar shakes:

- Banana-Salted Caramel Bread Pudding ($5):
This is one of the greatest things I've ever eaten...ever. It is a very generously sized piece of sticky bread, dripping in salted caramel and bourbon sauces, and covered in delicious pecans, all served HOT. There is really no better taste possible.

- Praline Caramel Bar ($3):
This bar was amazing. It was extremely moist and each bite had a delicious combination of chocolate and pecans in addition to the great taste of the praline base.

- Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Cookie: ($2):
I know I say this too often, but this was really one of my favorite peanut butter cookies ever. The cookie itself had a really deep peanut buttery flavor, which went extremely well with the chocolate chips studded throughout. There were also whole peanuts baked into the cookie which added a nice salty crunch to the cookie.

- Salted Caramel ($2):
And finally, we also tried one of the salted caramels, which is what they are most known for. Keeping with the nut theme, instead of getting the original flavor, we tried the "Third Nut" caramel. This was very delicious as well and the chocolate combined with the many different nuts was a great taste once again. I wish I fully checked my shame at the door and ordered at least one of each of the other two types of caramels as well since they sound great (the original, with sea salt on top, and the espresso chocolate, with pistachios on top).

- French Press Sightglass Coffee ($4):
To go with all of our sweets we also got some amazing coffee. I normally need at least some sweetener or milk on my coffee, but this was so good I didn't need to add anything. The flavor was so rich and it was nice and strong without being too bitter.

To add to the enjoyment of our sugar feast, the place itself has a very nice atmosphere. It feels like an old timey candy shoppe from the old west. In addition, the staff is super friendly and very helpful and nice to talk to. They engaged us in conversation, which was actually very pleasant, as opposed to some places where it can get pretty intrusive and makes you wish they would just leave you alone.

The friendliness of the staff just made the whole experience that much better. They also offer nice boxes of caramels to go. We loved it so much we bought a gift box of 10 caramels to go for $20.

Do not be deterred by the neighborhood and make sure you stop by Hooker's, you will not be disappointed.
author: Mike C.

description: This place should be on your SF bucket list for all its heavenly caramel treats! We had the most perfect "breakfast" this morning with their Apple Cherry bread pudding (divine!) with 2 cappuccinos. Also got the 10-pc box of caramels as a gift to go. Highly recommend a visit here!!
author: Shilpa J.

description:
How can $6 make me soooo happy?!?!?!? I've been wanting to come here for awhile, but every time I stopped by it was closed. I finally gone after I went to Turtle Tower. Okay, so it cost about the same as my bowl of pho at Turtle Tower, but the dark chocolate salted caramel banana bread pudding is that good! I got one, to-go, but right when she gave it to me in the little box, I felt it was warm. Hot even. I had to open it right away to take a bite! It already looked so pretty I didn't want to disturb it. I never thought bread pudding can have so much sauce to it. Warm, creamy, delicious caramel sauce! It keeps the bread from being too dry, but surprisingly the bread doesn't absorb it all and make it too sweet. She even added pecans over it. I don't even like pecans, but now I have an exception!

The bread pudding itself is very cake-like soft, but not too soft. It's chewy, and there might be a hint of rum possibly (?) cause it has that very small rum flavor that tastes great with bread pudding. There's also some hints of dark chocolate, but it's not very heavy. If anything, it added a bit of bitterness to the pudding, but it balanced the caramel very well. Surprisingly, after you eat it, although it looks really heavy, doesn't feel very heavy. Like you don't need water right away because it's so overwhelmingly sweet. Very impressed. It's $6, but if you like sweets and cake and salted caramel, then it's almost a steal. Either way, I can't get enough of it and now I keep thinking about it!!!
author: Jessica C.

description:
I noticed all the amazing reviews for this place on yelp and decided to stop by after a late lunch at nearby Lahore Karahi. Unfortunately, they were already closed :( 

However, a really sweet man let us purchase a box and a bag of their caramels. I tried a caramel that had pretzel sticks and chex on the top, a generous layer of caramel, and a dark chocolate layer on the bottom. I was pretty much BLOWN AWAY as soon as I took a bite! It tasted so so good and was really the perfect combination of sweet, salty, and rich. The pretzel and chex added a bonus crunch factor, which I really enjoyed. I'm planning on gifting a box to a friend who really loves caramels, and I'm positive she will go crazy for these. 

The shop is located in tenderloin, which might deter some, but these caramels are really worth it!
author: Fatima K.

description:
I was hooked with the first bite of a 3rd Nut Caramel. Their caramels are so good that I have not come across one person who has not liked them. They are definitely a small shop but that is a good thing in my opinion since it allows you to see their complete operation.

As long as they are open I will be go to them to satisfy my cravings for high quality caramels. Plus, you gotta love the names they give their treats.
author: Ray S.

description: Elite caramel makers and a sweet coffee shop/dessert bar..... Pun intended. Also, try the bread pudding.
author: Ben Y.

description:
Breath of fresh air for the Tenderloin.
Admirably cute, interesting, one of a kind candy/ coffee shop.
Easy to park and neighborhood vibe was good and safe as the police station is close by.

Wait staff was helpful to explain chocolates and caramels.
Easy place to buy a nice quick prepacked gift that is unique and tasty.
Prices are high... which is in alignment with the experience and uniqueness.

Everyone should get a Hooker (gift).
Highly recommend the salted caramel.
Not so much a fan of the other treats since I am not a chocoholic.
Very strong coffee will wake the dead.

Worth a stop if you are in the Theater District or out Union Square.
They might have started a trend to establish The Tendo as the ultra hip place to eat.
author: Janis C.

description: Love love LOVE this place.  It's my go to for all my client gifts. Who doesn't love home made camels?!.
author: Anne L.

description: Wow. Never knew the taste of handmade chocolates could be so good!  Delicious. No going back to packaged chocs for sure. The neighborhood's a little dicey, but cute shop. Looks cozy and loved.
author: Sue W.

description: Whenever I come here, I always feel like it's Christmas... The smell of the baked goods just warms you up... Not even taking into account that they taste GREAT!!! Seriously... The cookies, the bars, the bread pudding, and even the savory cheddar cheese scone that i had were all DELICIOUS!!! I actually first heard about this place because they have great coffee apparently, which is 100% true. They use a French press and brew each cup individually and it tastes amazing! The staff is always the sweetest; the first time I came here, they offered their salted chocolate caramel on the house as it was the one "that started it all." It tasted great and normally I don't like caramel. This place is seriously a jewel in the tenderloin. If you have a sweet tooth and haven't been here, you are missing out!
author: Kunal N.

description: Arrived about 15 minutes before the store closed and it looked like they were closed already. All the chairs were up on the tables and the door was only open just a crack. Still, I stuck my head in and was expecting to be told to go away, but the nice gentleman there just looked at me and said "Hi". I asked "can I still get some caramels?" and he was very nice and told me that I could still get caramels. Hubby and I came in and had a pleasant chat with the guy while deciding what to get. Ultimately we decided on getting the sampler box so we could try one of everything (the guy was a good salesman ;) All of the caramels were delicious and I would definitely go back and get more. Just like the name says, they are a treat!
author: Goldi J.

description:
It has been MONTHS since I've been able to stop by Hooker's. I finally had the chance today and satiated my cravings.

I took a friend with me because she had never even heard of bread pudding before. Now I got her addicted to it.

They only serve one flavor of bread pudding every time I've gone there and that hasn't changed. Today, they had Salted Caramel/Banana bread pudding. They also had a new chocolate piece in their display case so I got that for myself.

The new piece was an espresso caramel made with Ritual coffee, coated in dark chocolate, and topped with pistachios. Very delicious. I love that the caramels are soft to chew! Buttery, sweet, goodness. $2.50, I think. I don't remember.

The bread pudding was as delicious as I remember if not better. The bourbon caramel sauce is perfect. I wish they had put a little more on the plate just for my pleasure. $5. 

Service is sweet and attentive. And cute.

WONDERFUL place. Now that my friend's into it too, we're planning on going back again soon.
author: Sofia R.

description:
I just discovered this place and now I am in love with it. In love with their caramels, the coffee and their maple pecan scone. 

After training for two hours most mornings, when I am done I am dying for some great coffee and light morning snacks. I have turned this into kind of a mission, attempting to try a new local (screew Starbucks and Peet's) coffee place every day I train. The problem is, now that I have discovered Hooker's it is much harder to justify going someplace else. 

The first time went there, I got in just as they opened and you could smell the warm scones fresh out of the oven. The sweet smell of baked bread and maple permeated the air - I was in heaven. The small venue allowed me to unwind after a hard workout, sipping my coffee and mentally getting ready for the day. 

Since I am also a huge fan of caramel, I had to get a few for later that day, but I wasn't expecting much. I have gotten used to caramel just not being that good, since I grew up with my dad making caramel, perfecting his recipe over the years, such that I now don't care for any place that can't make an equally good product. To my surprise, Hooker's is as good as my father's, lovingly crafted caramel. Mind blow.

Do yourself a favor and go here on your next morning coffee break and start your day off right. Also pick up some caramels for later, you won't regret it.
author: scott h.

description: Caramel cashew cookie nut bar...oh em gee. Stopped in here with a friend to pick up treats for another friend ( he begged her to go to Hooker's Sweet Treats as soon as he found out she was visiting San Fran from NY). She bought a 10 box of a couple kinds of caramel. We tried a sample and it was delish. I'm not really a caramel person and had no intention of buying any. Then...I spied a tray of caramel cashew cookie bars on the counter and had to have one. So. Damn. Good. I was breaking off corners and nibbling on it all day. Now I wish I bought a lil something to go. They're closed on Sunday & Monday so no more caramel goodness for me before my flight out of town. But you lucky SF bastards should get some hooker treats in your life
author: Fatimah M.

description:
All I can say about this place is get there early or you are going to miss out. 
The gent who owns this little spot makes everything that morning on-site... at least from what I remember.

I admire that this is one of the few places I know of that serves espresso alongside a small cup of sparkling water (palate cleanser). 

A sweet cheddar biscuit paired with an Americano, ended with a salted caramel are my favorite round of treats. 

This place is small and has a homestead kinda feel. I like to sit by the window or on the wood bench outside and just "people watch" while sipping my Americano or espresso. :)

 This is always a treat when back in San Francisco
author: Sierra L.

description: The bread pudding covered with melted caramel and walnuts is top notch.  This along with fresh coffee will make any day sweet. It's a cozy place and you can definitely relax and enjoy your bread pudding . They also have other caramel treats. Definitely a new type of San Francisco experience. Will return for sure!
author: Nixon L.

description: Found out about Hooker's through our brokers who are obsessed with their caramels.  I ordered 8 assorted boxes of the ten-piece (at $20 each).  Totally worth it.  I've never had anything like it before.  Every bite was a piece of caramel heaven and you don't want it to ever end.  So far I've had the Straight BF Caramel (white chocolate) and the 3rd Nut Caramel - both of which are absolutely fantastic.  I want more!!!  Seven of the 8 boxes were sent out as gifts (note the packaging is pretty cool too).  Shout out to David who was so accommodating with my order request.  Thank you!  I hope to come by the store one of these days to try out their other treats.
author: Merlyn A.

description:
I work at a bank and their website is blocked. With a name like Hooker's, it figures right?

My coworker and I braved our way through the TL on Hyde Street (always full of character if you know what I mean) and made it to this yummy shop.

The caramels are so good! Not too sweet but so flavorful. The cookie was also amazing. They even gave me a free caramel for my bday. How sweet is that?
author: Betty C.

description:
Is it too early for Hooker's?

I received a box of the salted caramels as a gift in the AM and usually I don't like eating sweet sweets for my first meal.  Once I opened the box, I knew I couldn't resist to try one.  The saltiness from the sea salt made my mouth water but the sweetness from the caramel made me slurp everything back up.  

I might not be single but it's never too early, or too late, for some Hooker's.
author: Linda N.

description: As good as it gets. Seriously good coffee, espresso or French press coffee.Salted caramels... I have no words for quality here. Outstanding.
author: Monica S.

description: I love ordering Hooker's original smoke sea salted caramels as gifts for friends.  If you want to find a delicious local caramel made in small batches, definitely check out Hooker's Sweet Treats!  If you want to order for the holidays make sure to place your order online or for pick up, by the middle of December.  They will sell out the week before Christmas!
author: Wendy S.

description:
I have never in my life been a fan of caramel - prior to my first visit here, I could safely say that I hated it. Hooker's caramel, on the other hand, is absolutely otherworldly. I have been transformed from someone who would rather eat anything else, to a raving madwoman who would trek through the Tenderloin just to buy one square of their chocolate-sea-salt-caramel concoction of joy.

As if that weren't enough to convince you to go, they serve sightglass coffee and are quite friendly.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Hooker's caramels are organic, handmade in small batches on site, and hand dipped. The caramels (3 kinds) are $2 a piece. They also had cookies, bread pudding, sweet cheddar biscuits (sold out), caramel bars and Sightglass Coffee. The bread pudding actually has their caramels in it so it sounds worth trying.

* Original Hooker's caramel: A soft, chewy, buttery caramel square surrounded by thin coating of dark chocolate sprinkled with smoked sea salt. It was a little too salty but the salt helps cut into the sweetness of the caramel. It was softer, fresher and saltier than See's. 
* Latte: They don't have nonfat milk (boo) but you can choose between whole milk from Straus or soy milk. The latte was thick and lukewarm; a disappointing execution for good beans. 

The shop has old fashioned charm with an open kitchen, one big communal table, a wood cabinet and old b/w pictures. The neighborhood isn't pleasant though (try not to walk around too much). You can get their caramels at Bi-Rite, Rare Device, and Sightglass.

It's not cash only and they have a frequent buyer program. Use the same credit card and they'll keep track of it for you (I'm not sure what you can earn and when).
author: Lolia S.

description:
With this place being so close to me, I guess i really should go more often. This is not a place to go when you are on a diet. It is a place you to to reward yourself or someone you love. 

I had never really liked or tried bread pudding before. After I was called out for that, I decided to go ahead and finally give it a try for real. This was the best place in the world to do so! They use melted salted caramel and i could not be happier. I wish i had a straw to drink it up. It is soo good! I always get it to go, but the location is really cute. 

They are open earlier during the day so its always good to make sure to go right after brunch if you want to top of a great morning!
author: Ashley H.

description:
Hooker's is awesome.  Everything I tried was excellent.  The bread pudding was outstanding--perfect consistency, perfect sweetness, and the caramel sauce is lick the bowl delicious.  I would like to go and try a different bread pudding every day if I could.  The other treats are also great.  The caramel bar was delectable as was the peanut butter and chocolate cookie.  The caramels themselves were good as well--some better than others.  I'd suggest simply trying the original ones as they are a good riff on traditional chocolate covered caramels.  

Moreover, the staff is friendly and pleasant.  I love this place.
author: Julie M.

description:
People who say the caramels are expensive need to be slapped. Its a quality, artisan product that needs to be sold at a profit to sustain business. 

All the caramels are great. I like the Original Hooker the best.

Their  bread pudding is the my favorite of all time! I'm a HUGE bread pudding fan and its my favorite thing there. The flavor can change up but the texture/caramel stays constant. I can't stress enough how awesome it is. 

I don't love their other pastries (sweet cheddar biscuit, cookie) but I don't care. 

I don't love Sightglass coffee but its the best quality coffee in the immediate area. 

Decor is charming. Service has always been pleasant. An absolute gem of a cafe in our part of the TL
author: Monsieur_Meursault _.

description: This is my favorite place. The coffee is good, caramels are awesome, service is great! I go every chance I get!
author: Crystal L.

description:
A hidden gem in the tenderloin, these guys not only perfect caramels, but they're willing to go out of the box. Pun may be intended.

I've only been there once (boo!) and needed to go before I left the city. I grabbed several different kinds of caramels including their original and "the straight boyfriend". I also tried some other pastries that they had for the day and they were also amazing. I couldn't get through the day without eating all of them. I almost made another trip to get more (I am a fatty bo batty sometimes) but they close early on a Sunday and are not back open until Tuesday. My brief addiction subsided by then.

 The prices were not bad for my splurge ($13), can get more for your money than going to Mr. Holmes bakery.
author: Samantha E.

description: This is truly a hidden gem in the TL. Just FYI- it does close at 2pm on Fridays. I bought a 10 piece sampler box to take to work and it was a hit. The 3rd nut and original caramels were super delicious- but really all of them were amazing. Probably the best caramels that I have ever had. I can't wait to go back for more and try the bread pudding.
author: Reena P.

description:
Date & Time:  Tuesday June 15, 2010 @ 11:30am
Companion:  The Husband
Scene:  Foodies
Vibe:  Quaint  
Decor:  Charming & Cozy.  Circa 1880's.  Antique Mirror & WallPaper.   Blue & Brown Color Palette.  Pew Seating & Upholstered Chairs.
Service:  Nice Warm Couple
Imbibe:  SightGlass Coffee
Devour:  2 Boxes of Salted Caramel & Bread Pudding
Total:  $21.50
Note:  My Top Pick
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
So good.  This is the coolest sweet shop.  It's a great addition to the neighborhood.  Favorites are the salted caramels and the bread pudding.
HOWEVER: PLEASE, PLEASE expand your hours.  Would love to be able to hang out here in the early evening.  Something like this could really turn around the area.
author: Ric S.

description:
(See pic) Review #1251. What's a sugar breakfast with an excellent Sightglass iced Americano? Hooker's Sweet Treats!

It's in a white and blue setting, one big communal table, super sweet service, all on Hyde Street that can easily be missed. It's a few blocks farther from the tourist centric area so it's more for locals.

The stonefruit (apricot, peach and ) bread pudding was excellent as the fruits were seasonal with the happy sweet caramel.

The flourless chocolate brownie was very light on the weight but rich in the middle. The chocolate middle was so nicely chewy.

The only savory item here is sweet cheddar scone that was also very fresh and sweet and savory at the same time.

The Sightglass iced Americano was a perfect drink for a hot afternoon with all the sugary happiness.

Of course you don't want to miss out all the chocolate sweets. The espresso, caramel and the square that has the espresso in the middle were all so very rich.
author: T L.

description:
Items Selected:
Big Easy Bread Pudding with Raisins, Pecans, and Melted Caramel
Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Cookie with Melted Caramel
Caramel Bar with Cashew, Dark Chocolate, Smoked Sea Salt, and Buttered Caramel
Sweet Cheddar Scone

Located just a few blocks from my hotel and garnering praise for their dark chocolate caramels since 2010 it was largely for airplane snacks that I visited David "Hooker" Williams' small store before flying out on Tuesday afternoon and as much as the trio of bagged items would trump anything at SFO or LAS it was what I ordered in house that instantly placed Hooker's Sweet Treats on my rather short Bay Area "must return" list along with Knead, Humphry Slocombe, b.patisserie, and Saison.  Small in size and surprisingly hip in feel despite the Tenderloin locale a visit to Hooker's will likely entail a short walk amidst some of the area's most unfortunate yet once inside the cozy confines a more pleasant scene unfolds with wood and hues of blue strewn in NOLA-themed décor while notes of vanilla, cinnamon, and sugar permeate the air.  By all definitions an artisan operation with Williams working both counter and kitchen it was with friendly smiles that questions were answered and taking a seat at the windowside bar it would not be long before my order arrived, the caramel still bubbling as it dripped down the side of a golden mini-loaf into a fancy shallow bowl.  Generally preferring this style of pudding to more free-form versions served via slice or scoop the beauty of Hooker's Big Easy begins in the bread - a golden eggy thing with soft custard beneath crunchy top - and spruced up with raisins along with candied pecans for taste plus texture the dish is brought to new heights in the salty buttered caramel, a flavor surprisingly not too sweet but instead 'just right' in allowing cinnamon notes to shine for an almost savory finish...a flavor I'd later find equally present in all three takeaways, the smoky complexity of the cashew bar particularly satisfying when paired with coffee as I awaited yet another delayed plane.
author: Michael U.

description:
This place helped me discover a love for salted caramels I never knew I had. Each bar is absolutely delicious, and while it might seem like a single bar isn't worth $2 when you get it, once you take a bite in and realize one bar is really all you'll need, it's worth it. My favorite thus far is still the original salted caramel, but they have an awesome variety that is worth checking out. 

On a related note: I don't recommend their coffee, just because it seems over priced for how little you get. I recognize that sight glass coffee doesn't come cheap, but it still seems like they are nailing you a bit on a small brewed coffee for $3.50 or above. Maybe it's just me.
author: Michael Z.

description: Carmel gems so sweet to eat or gift. Double thumbs up treats.
author: Alexander T.

description: It's the best place to hideaway and get a great cup of coffee and caramel if you're dare to fall in love!
author: Melissa G.

description:
I felt a bit awkward searching "hookers" on Yelp, as I was a bit unsure of what may pop up.  Luckily, Hooker's Sweet Treats is so popular that it was the first result.  Hooker's Sweet Treats is located in the Tenderloin area, and it's a hidden gem.  

My boyfriend and I planned to visit Hooker's after seeing it on a list of the 10 best bread puddings in S.F.  
http://www.refinery29.com/best-bread-pudding-san-francisco/slideshow#slide-2
We visited on a Saturday afternoon around 12:30 p.m. and were warmly greeted by two men working.  They were very friendly and helpful in explaining the products that they offer and they made us feel at home.  We ordered the bread pudding, which happened to be banana-chocolate bread pudding that day (the guy said that it changes every few days).

The bread pudding ($5) is pre-made, but warmed up in the oven when ordered.  At the time of ordering, they also prepare the delicious caramel sauce.  It took about 5 minutes for the bread pudding to be brought to our table and it was well-worth the wait.  In the meantime, one of the guys brought us a bottle of water and two mason jars as well.  When the bread pudding arrived at our table, I'm sure both of our eyes lit up.  It was a fair-sized piece of bread pudding topped with pecans and drizzled/surrounded with a delicious, flavorful caramel sauce.  The bread pudding had a nice slight crispiness to some of the edges and was very moist on the inside.  The center of the bread pudding is filled with chocolate and a piece of caramel- a pleasant surprise that I wasn't expecting.  Overall, it was delicious.  If you like caramel, you will love this dish.

The bread pudding was plenty for my boyfriend and I to share- but another woman ordered one for herself- so it can be done.  The shop is not too big, but there was plenty of seating because it wasn't really too busy that afternoon.  It's cutely decorated and I hope to come back soon to try out their caramels.

Notes:
-They serve Sightglass coffee.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Can we say delicious caramels that are slightly raunchy without being adult porn shop? I mean the sweetness is just perfect and the flavor concepts are borderline revolutionary. 

I trekked up from Berkeley to the Tenderloin and i was so not disappointed. The service was excellent and recommended a gift package within my budget. The brothers not lovers was exceptional and I nearly died of happiness after I stuffed the entire thing in my mouth. Do not that's what she said me. It's immature and middle schooley. 

It has a cute antique vibe to it and I think I'll be back to sample more goodies and possibly some of that coffee!
author: Radhika P.

description:
Droooooooool.  This is by far my favorite San Francisco spot for treats.  

Every time I head out of town to visit friends, I grab a gift box for them with a variety of caramels.  The funny thing is that I don't really like caramel, but I love Hookers.  The bread pudding is also to die for, but it's probably not that healthy to eat one by yourself. Definite worth a trip!
author: Y L.

description:
CASH ONLY.  Walking up Hyde St I saw 2 guys get arrested by about 5-6 SF cops during the AM, I was heading to Hooker's Sweet Treats on Hyde @ O'Farrell.  It's a small place with a communal table and some chairs.  Order at the counter.

I had a hard time deciding what to get because everything sounded good, just kinda pricey.

I finally decided on the chocolate banana bread pudding $5 for a small rectangle.  It was made that morning.  He put it in a take-out container and then added some caramel sauce.  I was just going to take a few bites, but finished it.  It's GOOD!

Got a 3pc box dark chocolate sea salt caramels $7.  Small, very salty, creamy & smooth caramel.

Spiced iced coffee $2.5 sounded good, a guy recommended it to me.  They use Sightglass coffee.

Some people after me asked for lattes which I didn't see on the menu - ask & you shall receive.  Not sure how much it cost.

Recommended.
author: Ann L.

description: Literally the best caramel you will ever eat. Out of this world. One of my co-workers was gifted a box of these and neither of us knew what it was. We were blown away once we dived into the box. Seriously made my day. I couldn't stop talking about it!
author: Alice B.

description:
OMG, I had to sit down when I ate this.

A friend DRAGGED me here to try out one of the sea-salted caramels. And usually we have all had enough sweets to compare good and bad. The soft, sweet as well as salty chocolate covered melt in  your mouth caramel hit me so hard in the taste buds I actually had to sit down. 

It made me weak in the knees. My favorite was a plain pistachio topped treat, but now I will be haunted by the taste that I now know is out there.
author: Jerry K.

description:
I was never a caramel fan.  Most of them I tried were too sweet, too sticky, or too chewy.  But ever since I had my first piece of Hooker's at Sightglass coffee, I am hooked. Now this is my one and the only caramel place. I think it's really a payoff for using the simple and quality ingredients.

BTY, the 3rd Nut is truly nut lover's heaven, and the Sea Salted Dark Chocolate is coffee's best friend.
author: Stacey C.

description: The coconut, carmel, macadamia nut cookie-square is easily the best cookie on earth.
author: A B.

description:
During another work trip, I made it a point to get a Hooker for lunch while in the TL!  Har har har har. 

Go figure, Hookers is a CASH only business.  Har har har.  
All of my lame jokes aside, I loved the Salted Caramel that everyone speaks of is life changing!  I was fortunate to snag a few bites of my coworker's Chocolate Peanut Butter Bread Pudding, which was straight from Heaven! 

The décor of the place takes you back to the days of the Wild Wild West.  The menu is simple and written on the chalkboard which is to the left when you walk into the establishment.

Not a fan of the TL, but am definitely a fan of Hookers.  Guess I'll need to pack my bulletproof vest with me the next time I head to SF, just so I can get my hands on some Hookers.
author: kristine f.

description:
Definitely a problem in the making... 

Received a box of these tasty treats for Christmas and didn't share any (had to ration them).  Brought a fellow candy lover in this afternoon to sample these delicious treats.  She loved the salted caramels as much as I do and bought a box to gift a cousin.  On the walk back to Union Square we joked that maybe her cousin would prefer a Starbucks gift card so she could keep the caramels for herself...see, Hooker's Sweet Treats are a problem in the making!
author: Kim A.

description:
One star for the delicious caramels (and bread pudding).

One star for the great service I've received in the past (cute gift boxed candy for my wedding gift bags).

Minus three stars for the recently imposed limit on how much candy they will sell you.

I needed eight 3 piece gift boxes for the holidays. I was told I could only purchase three 3 piece boxes or one 10 piece box per visit. Um, ok. I asked if I could place an order and pick them up later in the week ( I realize it's all hand made and understand it's a busy season). I was told no, it's all first come first serve. Hmmmm...ok. 

Thankfully there are plenty of awesome candy shops in San Francisco that were more than happy to take my money. 

I realize in hindsight I should have just ducked outside an sent a few of the 'loin locals in to buy my candy in shifts, oh well.
author: Hannah S.

description:
I tried some Hooker's Sweet Treats the other day.  A few blocks over at a stand at the corner of Larkin, a pleasant young lady wearing a skin-tight leopard-print mini-skirt and five-inch-stilettos was also offering me some of her sweet treats.  Both preferred cash, but the lady was charging considerably more for her sweet treats that she refused to display only until after I agreed to purchase, so I went to Hooker's instead because they were much cheaper and I could see them making the treats I wanted to buy.

Having the insatiable sweet tooth that I do, I ordered everything on the menu on my first visit: a couple of dark chocolate covered caramels topped with sea salt, a sweet cheddar biscuit, a peanut butter chocolate chip cookie, and a raisin and pluot bread pudding topped off with warm caramel sauce.

The salted dark choco-covered caramels were delicious and hit almost all parts of the palate -- sweet, salty and bitter.  Haven't had a better peanut butter chocolate chip cookie in recent memory.  The raisin and pluot bread pudding, warmed up in their convection oven, and topped with warm caramel sauce was heavenly -- thick and dense yet still very moist with a crisp and dark golden-brown crust on top.  The sweet caramel sauce also had a very slight and subtle bourbon or whiskey kick to it.  I've had bread pudding from a number of places in SF and some pretty good ones in New Orleans as well, where it's more popular, but this was easily the best I've ever tasted.

I went back the following weekends for some more bread pudding.  Once it was chocolate and pecan and the other, chocolate banana.  Not as amazing as the raisin and pluot, but still excellent.
author: Erich D.

description: The peanut butter cookies were soooo awesome! I was mad that I only got one. We also got the sampler caramels, but my favorite was the one with the pretzels. Definitely worth a trip if you're in the area.
author: Chrissy M.

description:
Did someone say Hooker's? Why, yes please! Being Hooker virgins, my friend and I made our way out here after a mediocre lunch out at John's Grill, in search of some post-meal sweets, and showed up at this cozy little cafe in the middle of the TL, comfortably occupied by a variety of fellow patrons, deep in their studies, reading, or other cafe-ish preoccupations/

We settled upon some bread pudding, coffee, and a salted caramel to share. While the coffee and salted caramel were both okay, the bread pudding, of the coconut and pineapple variety, covered with a bourbon syrup, was amazingly tasty, and well-worth trying. And I don't even really like coconut!
author: Johnny W.

description:
Wait, am I in the Mission?  Hooker's Sweet Treats smack in the middle in the Tenderloin, who would've thought?  Quite happy to discover this cute little place!  

We made it in just before closing on Sunday, and unfortunately they were sold out of a lot of items such as the bread pudding and iced coffee.  But the sweet cheddar biscuit was delicious and the Sightglass coffee well appreciated.

I will be back soon enough to try the famed bread pudding and the salted caramels too.
author: Joanne G.

description:
There are a lot of hidden gems within the Tenderloin, and Hooker's Sweet Treats is definitely one of them. 

My friends and I visited on a Sunday morning around 11am and it was pretty quiet. Just a few patrons coming and going with their dogs in tow. Inside, there are some bar stools set up along the window and then a large communal table in the center. We love the laid back vibe - took pics with our phones and the photos look very vintage! 

We ordered a little bit of everything on the menu...chai, a latte, coffee (I feel I'd get the coffee again because it arrived in its own French press and was good for about a 3-4 cup serving...delicious dark roast too!) - for eats, of course we got a couple of the salted caramels, a peanut butter chocolate cookie, a cheddar biscuit, and the bread pudding of the day which was coconut blueberry in a sweet bourbon syrup. Everything was sinfully rich and paired wonderfully with our drinks. 

Definitely coming back again and again - I love Hookers!
author: Elaine W.

description:
Strawberry bread pudding and a soy spicy chai.

That's all you need to know here.

The strawberry bread pudding will dance in your mouth with such rich decadent flavor - that you won't be able to put down your fork.

Not even for a second.

And the soy spicy chai's frothy crown will cushion that pudding in pure Hooker's Sweet Treats elegance.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Hooker's Sweet Treats? Where did they come up with this name? Vulgar jokes from the interesting names aside, the cafe is located in the not so pretty side of town. 

== Food ==

Salted caramel. This is where all the action is at! There's currently six unique flavors with interesting names attached also. The original is amazing! Highly recommended if you're here for traditional salted caramel. One bite of this and I was in heaven.

Cappuccino. They make a pretty good cappucino. The bitterness of the cappucino goes really well with the sweetness of the caramel.

== Service ==

Service was awesome. Really friendly people.

== Overall ==

Really good stuff! Will definitely go back again even if I have to venture through the not so nice part of town.
author: Steven B.

description:
my favorite spot in the TL. tiny. cute. and pretty much perfect.

you have to get a caramel.  if you just want the coffee, go to sight glass.
author: Casey L.

description: I've been here a few times while I do laundry across the street. Their chocolates are very sweet but great to snack on once in a while. Their names for their chocolates are hilarious. Try them out!
author: Miko L.

description:
I am currently buzzing my ass off after my breakfast of outrageously sweet caramel, banana, pecan bread pudding washed down with a small pot of rocket fuel that is their french press coffee.   

I can imagine the crash and withdrawals that I am going to endure this afternoon thanks to this morning's powerful fix.  They say you can never recreate that first high, but I plan on chasing that dragon again ...real soon.
author: Dru P.

description:
It's great to see that there are more up and coming businesses choosing to make the Tenderloin their home. Hooker's is a great coffee shop that servers hand crafted drinks using Sightglass roasted beans. It's nice to see that they are using a local roaster and not trying to cut corners by using one of the big roasters. 

I was lucky enough to try one of their cheddar biscuits with my coffee. The biscuit was flakey and had a nice spicy kick to it. It was extremely well with my latte. Since I went with the biscuit, I did not get to try one of their famous caramels. I will definitely try one of those next visit. 

Thanks for the great cup of coffee Hooker's
author: Michael C.

description: I read review regarding Hooker's bread pudding and stopped by to get bread pudding to go. This treat is delicious and tastes like a thousand calories. Hooker's bread pudding is an amazing treat to give yourself once in awhile or you will weigh 400 pounds in no time. The owner is lovely and welcoming. I cannot wait until I have more time to sit down and enjoy my next bread pudding with a coffee and talk to the owner.
author: Sheila T.

description:
When in SF DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE!!!!

Your life will be incomplete if you don't try any of their salted caramels
author: David S.

description: We always get these caramels for special occasions and birthdays. Make sure to eat them within a couple of days of purchase. They don't keep well. Though it's hard for them to last more than a day in our household :D
author: Jen H.

description:
Until recently, I never really understood the draw of salted caramel. These, however, are excellent. Not too soft or too chewy, the right amount of chocolate coating, and not too much salt either. Just enough to pop.

And putting these most excellent salted caramels in baked goods? Mind = blown.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Can we just wipe the drool for a moment...

Their caramels are so delightful and unique!  Come for a treat or enjoy a cup of delicious coffee.  Seating is limited, but I haven't been here when it was crowded.
author: Casie M.

description:
Im in love with Hookers. 

Sweet sweet devil sweets!

I'm not big on candy, but I love love love some salted caramels, and Hooker's does caramels right.  These little babies are incredibly addicting but so worth the extra brushing you'll have to do on your chompers.  And if you feel like something a little less candy a little more hearty, indulge in their freshly baked goods (ahem, the bread pudding is to kill for, as in i would KILL YOU for it) while sipping on your latte or cappuccino.  

Dont be initimated by this area/neighborhood.  The TL gets such a bad rap, but its not nearly as bad as everyone makes it out to be.  And trust me, for these treats, you wont even care where you are.  Everything is good.  EVERYTHING.  I am never disappointed in this little shop of heaven.
author: Juv C.

description: Location isn't super-convenient, but inside is cozy, service is great and the quality is off-the-chart.  Had their banana bread pudding with berries, which was soaked through with sauce.  Decadent.  French press coffee and a walnut maple scone.  Loved the decor as well.
author: Richie T.

description: If sex was a food it would be Hooker's Chocolate covered caramel. I think I went to heaven when I took my first bite of one.
author: Julianna I.

description:
Thank you for this gem. 

Great everything, great attitude, great decor. 

Bread Pudding? Cheddar Biscuits? Salted Caramels? SightGlass Coffee?

Everything on the menu is amazing. 

Hook and Matt are super nice people.

Keep killing it Hookers.
author: Carson L.

description:
I was early for an appointment in the city so I figured I'd yelp a near by coffee shop. 

Being in San Francisco, there are a million coffee shops in walking distance, but the name Hooker's Sweet Treats caught my eye (I have a sweet tooth!). The pictures from other yelpers definitely sealed the deal that I would be trying out this establishment. 

I bought one of their Lemon-Blueberry Bread Puddings. I ordered it to go since the location is little and all the tables were taken and figured I just go back and eat it in my car.... it didn't make it to the car. I busted that thing opened as soon as I was out the door and devoured the warm gooey DELICIOUS bread pudding. Three blocks later, I have no yummy picture to share with you all but I definitely recommend if you are near Hooker's Sweet Treats go in and get a bread pudding!
author: Jasmine M.

description:
Yum, yum, and yum! The little coffee pastry shop is a little slice of heaven in the Tendernob. Swept from some French country town, for sure, this place boasts some of the best hand made caramels, delicious coffee, and quaint ambiance that will make all your worries melt away. 

While they have different deserts to choose from, I always go for the classic - salted caramels. With a cup of cappuccino done just right it is a treat that makes me smile with every bite (and chew) I take. Heaven.
author: Yelena K.

description:
Whenever I am feeling under the weather I cheer myself up with something sweet and sinful- and no over the counter candy bar will suffice! I was at Civic Center Bart this morning and used the yelp app on my Droid to get the address and cross streets for Hooker's Sweet Treats in the TL. After finding out it was 0.4 miles away I paused wondering if it was worth the walk the way I was feeling. Well I had Madison with me and she needed her morning walk so I figured what the heck, it's at least down hill on the return trip. 

@10 minutes later I arrived in front of Hooker's. The only thing out front that differentiates it from any of the other poorly maintained buildings was the clean wooden bench for customers to sit on. In other words you'll want to know the address before you attempt locating it.

There was a cute young hipster couple in front of me who ordered french press coffee and carmels, other than that I was lucky to have the place to myself while I tried to choose between the offerecd sweets. I finally decided on a mocha (with soy of course my LA friends) and a sea salted carmel square. Because I love sight glass coffee I already knew the mocha would be perfect, not too sweet, but sweet enough you don't need to add anything to it. An impressive job of steaming the milk to the perfect temp, stopping just before it would scald your tongue but still having enough heat you know it won't be cold the last few sips.

The carmel was heavenly. About a perfect square inch and a half inch thick it was dipped in chocolate and sprinkled in sea salt. It was the most delicious carmel I 've had in SF, even the texture was perfect. And the way it complimented my mocha.. ahhhh!! I reccomend that you buy two because one is absolutely not enough. At $2 each that may seem expensive but it is worth every penny. I had to walk a block back because I made the mistake of only buying one! Bring $10 with you and I promise you heaven and perfect satisfaction. The barrista will be happy as well because that leaves him $1.50 change for a tip!
author: Lisa H.

description:
If you are in the area and craving something sweet or coffee you can't beat this place!  The salted chocolate caramel is amazing!  The guys working are always friendly and cool!  Even provided a doggie treat and bowl of water for our old dog this last visit!  Spread the word so this treasure place sticks around!  
They also do cool little gift boxes for those you/we deem worthy to share this bit of deliciousness with!
Hooked on Hookers!
author: Sean M.

description: Excellent caramels, rude staff. Considering their location, there are far better places to spend your time.
author: Ren R.

description:
I have to give them 5 stars. The sea salt caramel is just that awesome and so is their spicy chai. The 2 guys behind the counter were super friendly and chatted with me about my weekend plans, the Folsom street extravaganza and let me try a piece of the caramel they were making. 

I had bookmarked Hooker's back when my manfriend lived close by. I never got a chance to check it out, forgot about it and today I knew I would be in the neighborhood and searched for it again. 

Do you know how awkward it is searching for "hooker" on Yelp while in the T-loin? Especially when there are legitimate hookers around the corner... however I don't think they are on Yelp...

They have other items (like bread pudding) that I will definitely come back to try.
author: Sara P.

description:
This rating is based solely off of their bread pudding. I've been approx three times, all for the same sticky sweet dessert. It is much sweeter than most bread pudding, mainly because of the sauce that is drenched over it as it is served. Very rich. One serving is enough for two to share just from sugar overload. 

Still waiting for a chance to go back for the caramel. The guys inside are always very friendly. Feels a bit mom and pop.
author: A K.

description: We showed up as they were closing but they were still kind enough to sell us a few treats. My favorite was the cashew-caramel-shortbread cookie. I'd make a point of going back here. It's legendary for good reason.
author: Laura H.

description: Tried the pineapple/blueberry/coconut bread pudding. It was swimming in  caramel sauce. The first bite was overwhelmingly sweet, but if you get enough bread pudding and just drizzle a bit of sauce on to, it's perfect. I love the quirky name and the atmosphere.
author: Alice W.

description: Great coffee and incredibly delicious treats! Laid back, New Orleans feel with great service and a friendly owner.
author: Amanda T.

description:
Hooker's, Hooker's, Hooker's...

Hubs and I went to Hooker's right when it opened on Saturday before starting our food expedition around SF.  The place is super cute inside and the staff are very friendly.  We got the 10 piece box with 8 original salted caramels and 2 of the new salted caramel w nuts atop dark chocolate.  We sat on the cute bench outside of the store and ate one of each.  Personally, I thought the caramel part was too soft.  I prefer it to be a tiny bit harder.  Regardless, the delicious morsels had us wanting more.  But no, we had to restrain ourselves because we knew that there were so many other food places we had to go to that day.  It had the perfect amount of saltiness and the dark chocolate covering them were mm mmm good!!  Only bad thing is that they're $2/piece!  I would still go back if I was in the area so I guess that says something.
author: Lanna K.

description:
Lovely staff! Expertly prepared coffee. Delicious treats. 
I'm glad these guys are in my neighborhood. A beacon of light, in the heart of the TL.
author: Lalo H.

description:
After reading about the salted caramels here I had to take a long break from work to treat myself to some of Hooker's Sweet Treats.  You can buy them singly at around $2 a caramel so it's a rare treat but it is so worth it.  Quality salt and nice soft chewy caramel.  Worth every penny.

I also wanted to try their cookies but it seems they often run out in the afternoon.  So call ahead if you want a sweet treat after lunch.
author: Jean K.

description:
why so much for a caramel? No caramel on the planet is worth 5-6 dollars.

Also, I got yelled at for sitting on that bench outside.

I wonder how this got "best of the bay". it really is shocking to me.
author: Stevie D.

description: If my mother lived close enough I would walk to her house, ring the bell and slap the hell out of her. These treats are incredible!!!! I was gifted with the smore caramels for my birthday this week, I dont want to talk about how quickly I ate them all. Totally worth crashing from a sugar high. I'm told these are ideal for special occasions, if thats the case, everyday is a celebration.
author: P F.

description: After being dissapointed by a few of the coffee shops that had high yelp ratings in the neighborhood, I finally found a gem. The best Americano I ever had and the cheddar scone was very good too, thank goodness I can leave San Fran on a great note!!! Ty I'm a happy hooker
author: Sook K.

description:
Bread pudding --- amazing! Though should probably share with someone

Hot chocolate --- pure and delicious

Sea salt caramels --- got the box of three....HEAVEN! The one with nuts was especially great.

Great little place, and the owner was so hospitable! 

Worth the trip over
author: Linda H.

description:
Coco brown hookers are my new found addiction.  "Hey baby, what's it gonna be?", they ask me.  I wave my Jacksons and point to everything.  "Ok honey, daddy wants the Tenderloin special...line up girls."  She winks and says, "Sugah, you're in for sumthin' sweet!"

"Honeydosugachocolate dumplin' yeah Sista with a certain sumthin' sumthin' Flavor with a cocoa kinda flow Baby, baby act like you know" (Musze 1996)

I received a couple boxes as a gift from San Bruno yelper, Kim A.  OMG!  This sh*t is crack!  I'm a huge fan of salted caramels and these delectable treats are amazeballs!  Substantial, gooey and generously salted.  The hardest part is pacing yourself and not indulging in more than one at a time.  Another new found addiction.
author: Kalani C.

description: What a find! Tucked in the Tenderloin, who knew that this neighborhood was hiding something sweet. Love it!
author: Hans D.

description:
My friend gave a glowing recommendation, so I made the trip to Hooker's and was overjoyed with the atmosphere, latte, and treats!  It was the perfect start to my Sunday morning.

To drink, I ordered a double-shot latte.  The latte was delicious and paired perfectly with the caramel-covered praline and peanut-butter chocolate cookie.  The caramel used is the perfect blend of sweet and buttery, and it just melted in my mouth as I enjoyed the blend of flavors.  The peanut-butter chocolate cookie was a delicious surprise.  The consistency of the peanut-butter leads me to believe it was homemade, and the final product was a super-tasty cookie.  

The atmosphere is pleasant and well-decorated.  The best I can describe the decor is masculine and western.  Every decoration is carefully considered and placed.  Also, the owner (Hooker) and assistant (Matt) engage with the customers in conversation and lend to a personable, fun experience.

I will be recommending Hooker's to all of my friends, and as soon as you try Hooker's, I know you will be doing the same.
author: Justin D.

description: I actually rarely eat sweets but their salted caramel is just insane!!  Seriously.. Gotta try it.
author: Ken J.

description:
I had the carmel and coconut bar with a friend of mine and a peppermint mocha. MMM MMM So delicious. They used organic milk which is always cool with me. 

The shop is very small with limited seating and a cute little bar with stools right against the window. The service was really nice and the treats live up to the name. Actually, the guys are cuties that work there so you get some eye treats also. 

I'll need to go back to review the other treats they have available. Further investigation needed (wink wink). 

Go there. You'll love it.
author: Cia G.

description: Tried this place out because we saw it featured on UNIQUE SWEETS- sooo good! I always thought maybe the show exaggerated how good the goodies are- yeah, no- they're even better than we expected!!
author: Chris G.

description:
I was gifted a box of Hooker's Sweet Treats caramels this week & wanted to scream (from a mountain top) every yelp hyperbole I swear I'd never use...best I've ever had! Changed my life forever! FOREVER! Touched my heart, soul & tastebuds in a way no food ever has! Ah-may-zing! Nothing compares!

The sad thing is, none of those are really exaggerations. The stuff was so good that I dragged my BFF there today to get my fix again. $2 each, we got a mix of dark chocolate salted caramels & nutty caramels w/ a thin, chocolate coating on the bottom (I *just* love surprises!) So super buttery. And the best part is that the chocolate outside isn't a hard, separate shell...it's as soft as the caramel & when you bite down, it's one cohesive flavor combo & texture. Good ingredients all around. 

Whoever thought to combine chocolate & caramel & sea salt deserves a kiss (with tongue!) 

The Hyde Street coffee & confection shop is adorable (blues & browns, my favorite!) We sat & had ceramic cups of Sightglass coffee (which we didn't fancy; BFF & I are hardcore Philz advocates.) I'll be back for them caramels. They make good gifts, if they last long enough to get to their rightful recipients (odds of that happening: unlikely. I'm keepin' them for myself!)
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I don't generally write Yelp reviews, but I felt compelled after reading Clace F.'s review on 2/8/12, as I am the lethargic customer mentioned in the review.  This false account of the service doesn't sit right with me.  

Being a regular, I often come in lethargic (who isn't in the morning?) and sit down without a word, and the owner, David, knows what I want.  That being said, the reality of what happened:

I walked in, sat down, received eye contact from the owner, and proceeded to sit quietly and wait for my coffee as I do most mornings.  You, dear reviewer, were already there and waiting for your bread pudding.  A few minutes later a gentleman walked in and up to the counter to order, to which the owner told him there was another customer before him (I believe he was referring to both of us actually).  He explained the coffee was made to order and the French press would take some time.  I took the situation as the owner just letting the man know it would be more than a minute to get his coffee, as he looked in a hurry.  The man obviously was and left.

As for regulars laughing, you are again mistaken.  The owner commented to us that good coffee takes time after the man left.  There was no laughter.  The comment wasn't a joke.   We agreed.  Noticing a man doesn't have time to wait isn't a comment on him, but mere fact.  There are mornings when I am in a hurry and do not have time to wait.  I would appreciate a business owner warning me of a wait.  It means he is paying attention to the fact that I am rushed.  

Glad that's cleared up.  Now I can get back to work and school, so I can wake up tomorrow lethargic and know there is great coffee (and bread pudding) right across the street.

--Lethargic (and satisfied) regular
author: Christine T.

description: Best Caramel treats! Every single one is amazing. I recommend buying them all! Top if of with a cashew bar:)
author: Cristi B.

description:
I came here because my dad's middle name is Hooker (no jokes please, it dates back to the civil war) and wanted to buy him a San Francisco treat.  My father, Joseph Hooker Killingbeck, IV, (no relation to the shop) a chocolate connoisseur, took one bite of the dark chocolate salted caramel and I quote; "This was the best I've ever had".  

I agree.
author: Alex T.

description:
After some very boring time filing court documents I thought I would treat myself. Ron said we needed to visit a hooker. At first I was leery until he led me in here.

Ho-ho...funny man. I must admit this place has a really great name!

Bread pudding and a nice french press cup of coffee turned my day from rather blah to Hell-yeah in the time it took for me to enjoy it. The ambiance is decent and the service was polite but rather ho-hum. However the delights they serve easily push this to a solid 4+ on the ole rating scale.

I will be back to sample more of what they are selling because the first and last bite of that pudding was so damn good.
author: Nick B.

description: Don't leave hookers without trying the bread pudding and Carmel bite
author: Mel S.

description:
Definitely a diamond in the TL. I love this place. A little hidden, but this place makes delicious treats and very fresh french pressed coffee. I've had a variety of their snacks, and the salted caramels are the way to go (nut and chocolate). The coffee is delicious, and and the place has done a great job creating a very nice ambiance where you can sit and enjoy your treats. 

I've been here twice in the past two weeks, and the service has always been great. Although they cook everything at the spot, it doesn't smell super buttery which is a bit odd. With the name and location, it's always funny when you are searching for this place and what else pops up. Can't wait to go back!
author: Laura H.

description: The best of the best! After two years of going to this café, it is still a pleasant experience to have their pastry and coffee. The people are friendly, the service is great, and the pastries to die for!
author: Khashayar F.

description:
A local treasure filled with yummy goodness, great coffee, and wonderful service. I finally had to write a review on yelp, and decided that Hooker's Sweet Treats deserved my first review!! By the way, their bread pudding is to die for and should be shared with someone special!!
Thanks Hooker's and see you soon!
author: Naomi C.

description: Caramels were on the chewy chewy side, no complaints here. Iced Americanos are a-ok too. I paid $10 for two caramels and two iced americanos.
author: Josie C.

description:
I am HOOKED on Hooker's Sweet Treats!!!

When I first heard of this place, I was pretty pervy minded. Until a friend dragged me over here did I finally understand what she was talking about. 

Here's what's up: 
*  Dark Chocolate-covered Caramels with sea salt
*  Sweet Cheddar Biscuits
*  Strawberry Bread Pudding. 
*  Spicy Chai Latte

Friendly service, a local neighborhood business and this place satisfied my sweet tooth for the week. 

Hooker's has a late 1800's antique feel to it and is almost like walking into a confectioner's store. 

Leave your plastic cards at home, this place deals with CASH ONLY.

I think I am salivating for more again..
author: Jason C. J.

description:
I'm addicted to hookers... wait... that sounds very wrong...

AMAZING salted caramels. amazing. $2 a pop but will make all caramels you've ever had obsolete. Really great packaging and super cool all around. I can watch him make caramels all day. The place is cozy and has some pretty cool antique bits scattered throughout. I have a sickness and the only treatment is more hookers!!
author: Melissa W.

description: Great spot! Can't believe I've been living a block from here for two years and never knew it existed. Love the caramels just bought a box to take to home to my parents. Perfectly packed in a little box that fits right in my carry-on
author: Conrad G.

description:
Don't get any funny ideas about the business name!

So I finally got a chance to buy these delicious handmade "sea salted dark chocolate covered caramels". They come packaged in "eco-friendly" boxes. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hookers-sweet-treats-san-francisco?select=zo_zUVkL_KrVqT5uxwCIeg#6J1hD1E67oqQIH3PgXrDuQ I love that they look like elegant little old-world candies. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hookers-sweet-treats-san-francisco?select=zo_zUVkL_KrVqT5uxwCIeg#mU9Ju1IqyGA7tFUlfaEGNQ The sweet caramel and rich dark chocolate are accented by sea salt, for a unique flavor. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hookers-sweet-treats-san-francisco?select=zo_zUVkL_KrVqT5uxwCIeg#HFFTLEDI36h8E75u-NjmTg The ingredients used are certified fair trade and organic.
