The caramels are sold in boxes of 3 pieces ($7) or 8 pieces ($15). http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hookers-sweet-treats-san-francisco?select=zo_zUVkL_KrVqT5uxwCIeg#4V5MbWP9-9MTejU3Ujo9qA Yeah, not exactly cheap, but similar to pricing of gourmet chocolate by the pound. The website mentions that online ordering will start in the 2009 fall season via email (info@hookerssweettreats.com).

** Update: Originally the treats were sold thru Sightglass Coffee on 7th Street @Folsom (daytime), and The Perish Trust on Divisadero. The cafe opened in June 2010 (gritty neighborhood, near 38 Muni bus stop), serving Sightglass brand coffee drinks ($2.50-$4.50) and adding many other delicious goodies - hot caramel sauce topped bread pudding ($5, seasonal flavors), cookies ($2-$3), etc. (caramels are now $2 each). And they now accept credit cards.

Cafe hours: Tue-Fri 8am-4pm, Sat-Sun 10am-2pm
Closed Mondays.

Enjoy!
author: Luis C.

description:
Bring your insulin because this place ail put you into diabetic coma.  A beautiful, restful diabetic coma.

I happened upon Hookers when I found them at Sightglass coffee.  I was an immediate convert.

I took some to a client and now that client demands them everything I visit. 

Don't miss the bread pudding.  It ail add 1000 sit ups to your work out.  But it's worth it.
author: Danny D.

description: Espresso iis yum and very strong. Caramels, caramel espresso cookie bars, and cheddar biscuits all yum. Its small, lovely, and precious. Definitely a neighborhood spot. When I'm in the TL I stop here, I wish you opened earlier and stayed open later :()
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Tucked away in the heart of the TL, it may take you a few passings by to notice this neighborhood gem. 

The interior is cozy, and charming knickknacks and antique goodies are artfully tucked away in nooks and crannies and strewn about on shelves.

Always a solid cup of coffee (Sightglass) no matter what you order, and the accompaniments are absolutely delicious. Bread pudding and sweet cheddar biscuits top my chart, but I can't leave out the salted caramels, either. They make a great post coffee snack, and are available in larger quantities for gifting that special someone-with-a-sweet tooth.

Service is quick, and the staff, courteous. 

My only real complaint is that they don't serve iced latte's. I have to venture elsewhere for my caffeine fix on the hot (indian) summer days. Probably something to do with not wanting to ruin that amazing texture from the heavy cream they use. Hello, Clover!

Cash only bar, so come prepared. 
And bring a friend!
author: Carol C.

description:
A hidden gem of the TL.

 I don't have a sweet tooth - so I usually skip on the treats, BUT the coffee is great, and staff is super nice. Over the summer, I enjoyed their spiced iced americano.
author: Pedro H.

description:
To sum it up: No Fault Candies (salted caramels) and Desserts
Returnability: Every day
Superstar Factor: On the superstar scale, Hooker's Sweet Treats is the candy shop/cafe equivalent of the porn star you want to dive into again and again.

Move over, Crack. There's a (relatively) new addictive substance in town. I mean, Hooker's is not like a Saison or Coi. It's that sinfully delicious dirty (it's actually quite clean) darling that you can't take your mind off of. This candy destination, located in a convenient, but not very sweet part of town (which does not detract from its magnetic qualities in the least), is one of those places I cannot find any fault. It is certainly one of the TL's little purveyors of mouth pleasure. For one thing, it's cheaper than the other kind and secondly it's for sure less likely to cause infection. The pumpkin bread pudding with the baked in chocolate covered salted caramel was heavenly. The coffee is Ritual. The staff is friendly. Chocolates go one for $2, three for $7 (for the packaging) and ten for $20. I love the salted caramels, especially the ones with nuts. Honestly, who doesn't like nuts? Am I taking this whole "hooker" thing too far? I know, I know. Despite the colorful local "help," the hooker in Hooker's Sweet Treats is actually the proprietor's nickname.  

Anyway, let's talk more about the important things, like this bread pudding. Sultry caramel wraps its arms around a dense, moist and not overly sweet pumpkin bread pudding. The bread pudding cradles a secret heart of oozing chocolate and caramel. And, yes, there are nuts on top. ;)
author: Jess C.

description: Salted caramel goodness..'nuff said.
author: Kim G.

description: This place was the bomb! Got the bread pudding for a work meeting and everyone loved it!
author: Jeremy J.

description: Great bread pudding with wonderful caramel sauce. A must for the sweet tooth. The 10 piece sampler is slightly high in price but definitely worth the price. Find an excuse to go for them and you won't be disappointed!
author: J Y.

description:
This place is MARVELOUS. 

I confess it is my new addiction. I can't get enough salted caramels. Not to mention the mocha is just superb, not too sweet and is the perfect thing to wake up to. 

While they may be known for their salted caramels and other confections, please try the cheddar biscuit. It is SO good. Not to mention the bread pudding could totally help me gain a few pounds. 

The decor is fabulous and the staff is always friendly but never too overwhelming for early morning visits. It might be in the TL but make a trip over here, look out the window at the tweakers and the pigeons that are going through it, and lastly enjoy this San Francisco gem.
author: Jeremy R.

description: This place was featured on the cooking channel so decided to give this place a try. Their salted caramel is outrageous. The bread pudding is phenomenal. Don't forget to take some to go. The whole team is extremely nice and gave a great explanation of the sweet treats philosophy. There were two additional customers that walked in stating they heard great things about their chocolates, so they needed to try. Give this place a try! Fair warning this stuff is addictive. Metered (credit card) parking is available on the street.
author: L G.

description:
Sightglass coffee runs a close second to Four Barrel, in my opinion.

But I prefer my beans robust, like my mens, not sure about you haha.

That said, this is a tiny coffee front filled with lots of sweets (that I've yet to try) and a whole lotta love from the sweetheart barista behind the counter. 
 
Support your local coffee shops!
author: Josie M.

description:
When life gives me lemons, I get Hooker's. Here's my short list: dark chocolate-covered caramels flecked with sea salt (yes), a nutted version with a base of dark chocolate (my preference), a spiced chai latte (!!!), sweet cheddar biscuit (more exclamation marks), and unreal peanut butter chocolate chip cookies. Cash only. Closed on Mondays. Great if you live in the neighborhood. Worth the walk in.

I generally find myself crestfallen after stomaching a Monday back at the office after a weekend of blowing off steam after a week of bottling up the dark matter. So come Tuesday, when the lights at the crosswalk on Geary conspire against my preferred steady pace through the throngs of tourists, junkies, kids and conventioneers, it's with great pleasure that I walk in the opposite direction, down Hyde and into a shopfront that'd be easy to miss and one's usual, hurried pace. 

And what light. I'm not talking the luminescence of the several few scattered Edison bulbs, or the lamps in the back illuminating the baking area, nor do I speak of the raw sewage-colored light reflecting off the building facades across the street. No. This is the light of warmth. From David "Hooker", the friendly gent that runs the place, to the slight heat coming from the ovens in the back, the smell of baked goods and the patina on the collection of slightly nautical, if not coastal Americana inside. 

Of course, the salted, dark chocolate caramels are excellent. Subtle in taste and texture; just a wonderful bit to let hang around in your mouth. It tells great stories, but doesn't cause a ruckus. The other version, boasting a base of dark chocolate and family of nuts in a small Vanagon of caramel resting on top, really topped it for me. Add to that subtle wonder of the Original, and put the lovely, nutty pleasure of nuts. Crazy, baby. They have Sightglass Coffee. The spiced chai latte is both refreshing and savory, perfect for any climate, and the peanut butter chocolate chip cookies just slay. Like everything here, it's subtle: the peanut butter flavor just playing rub-a-dub footsie with the chocolate, a base of moist yet almost chewy cookie, and peanuts. 

My personal favorite: the sweet cheddar biscuit has a wonderful, almost cornbread texture (when cornbread is moist and cakey), with a slight spice somewhere in there. Eating that and walking to work makes me think that the lights on O'farrel are changing just to keep my walk leisurely, despite the engineering of people with big brains, who program those lights to change at some pace that's a mystery to me. A mystery it should remain.
author: Roy M.

description: Great hidden gem and the place gets bonus points for  letting us tell friends we got chocolate from hooker's in the tl.
author: beverly l.

description: Hands down first in class. I'm a caramel and cupcake junkie. I will be shipping to east coast. They are worth the trek through the neighborhood.
author: Marci H.

description:
The Cajun Corn Bread is to die for.  This place has gotten me seriously hooked on Sight-Glass coffee.  I mean, it's gotten to the point now where I am buying in bulk and grinding my own all day at work.

Honestly, I love the minimal, no frills, no-ego atmosphere this place brings.  It's welcoming, but isn't implying you stay for 6 hours and work on a laptop.  It's everything you love about neighborhood coffee shops, but without everything you hate about Starbucks and Peets.  It's not even fair to compare.

David knows what he is doing.. and I beg you to let him make you a cup of his Joe.  You won't be at all disappointed, unless you are expecting a laser light show to go with it.
author: John D.

description:
ok.  I hope that my readers understand that this is a dessert place.  I'm serious.  Please don't judge me.  All I did was drink coffee and eat some pudding/chocolate with my fellow staffs.

Salted Caramel Chocolate:  It sounds pretty weird but actually, it's real good.  
French Press: I loved it
Bread pudding: descent...actually pretty good....=)

too many great coffee/dessert joints in SF.  I'm not sure if i'll be ever back due to many great joints in SF.  It didn't hook me in any way.
author: Jang David K.

description: This was a delightful find that my GF made while watching a cooking show.  We tried pretty much everything on their menu and enjoyed everything.  I had the cheddar bisquit and thoroughly enjoyed it.  The Coffees we had were good and obviously the sweet treats were very good.  So good, we bought some to take home with us to So Cal.
author: Michael D.

description: Absolutely amazing and most definitely worth the walk over - I got a selection of each available caramel and they were all unbelievably delicious.
author: Audrey G.

description:
A week of brothels* and Hookers.

I can't comment on the, um, other offerings in the Tenderloin. But I can say that this Hooker and his caramel praline cookie is awesome. The caramel is baked right in. He turns quite the trick.

He charges by the cookie. Not the hour. The deed goes down in a well designed space filled with vintage artifacts.

You will leave feeling anything but cheap and won't feel the least bit ashamed. You might even become a repeat customer. And tell everyone.

*http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-old-ship-saloon-san-francisco#hrid:MWVVzV4YqKf_nclhlpBNXA
author: Jason B.

description:
I have been to Hookers about 4-5 times now and I am 'Hook'ed ;)!
  
Everyone who works there is really friendly and I am was really impressed that despite not making it there in about three months, "Hooker" (the owner) remembered our conversation that we had had there previously.  Definitely very receptive to feedback because I had asked about Sunday hours back when Hooker's was closed on Sundays, and sure enough, now they are open on Sundays!

I have tried the coffee which is really delicious and also the bread pudding, praline cookies, and the caramels.  There is no hit-or-miss here, I have never had anything that I would not get again.

I plan to continue visiting this gem and hopefully will soon be able to call its neighborhood home and able to visit waaay more often!
author: Chad P.

description:
i know my DH loves me because he bought me a box of Hookers handmade salted caramels. DEEELISH. worth every mm of fat that will be on your hips after each bite lol  
adding this place to my list of favorite chocolate places
author: joyce l.

description:
This place has a very small candy selection, but if you love salted caramels, oh my!  They have versions with and without chocolate.  

There's a hint of graininess in addition to the chewiness of Hooker's caramels that I like better than the texture of a typical caramel.  And I loved the salty-sweet taste.  They are a *little* too sweet for me, so I made an open-faced sandwich of the caramel with my own dark chocolate and that was a perfect level of sweetness.  

My very favorite is the three-nut chocolate caramel; again, the nuts cut back the sweetness a bit.  Next time I can get over there I will definitely be buying some more.
author: Susan C.

description:
A hidden gem of a place. Awesome space, awesome unique treats, and awesome staff. Coffee and cake brought to our table. That type of service is rare at coffee shops these days so the extra touch is appreciated.
Tip: They are known for their caramels but try their specials, you'll be surprised.
author: C T.

description:
I was dead set on choosing one of the many disappointing spots I've visited for my next review - after all, I have to worry that my integrity as a reviewer would be questioned by either algorithm or person for writing reviews which are suspiciously dandy. 

Well, I can't, please believe me natural-language-reading machine: this place merits the reputational risk.

Why?
1. Fantastic Sightglass beans accompanied by the expert hand at using them which they deserve.
2. Those caramels... Well, I don't feel that I need to say anything about them, since the issue has been chewed over (pun intended). I agree with every word and with respect to both types, new and old. I'll just say that the new type is so sweetly salty that I am afraid I am running the risk of an addiction.
3. The caramel cookie (not the choclate chip. haven't tried that one).
4. The people.
5. The music.
6. The curio whole in the wall and the delight you derive from sitting there on the bar stool and looking outside while reading.

After all that complaining about the inaccessibility of wifi would just be grousing.
author: tal n.

description:
I've seen the buzz as well as walk by, but just never made it into the store.  But not today!

Wowie, one salted and chocolate coated caramel later. I've only eaten half and it's amazing! Soft, rich, wicked complexity and with just the right amount of salt to jolt you awake to pay attention to all of it.

Cap it off with a thickly foamed americano with a healthy dose of cream...

Somehow, these piles of papers at work don't seem so horrible after all!
author: Rebecca R.

description:
Hooker's in the Tenderloin? Who'd a thunk it?!

I can poke fun at the name but the sweet treats coming out of this tiny storefront are no joking matter. The salted caramels pack a salty/savory punch while the cookies are flavorful and well worth the $2.50.

This little shop is well worth searching out if you have a sweet teeth and need a fix during your weekday.
author: phil h.

description:
Unique decor, friendly staff, strong coffee.

A wonderful addition to the neighborhood. 

The treats are TO DIE FOR!
author: Stephanie B.

description: Who would've known that hooker's sweets would be such a treat :). I love everything about this place, from the decor to the friendly staff to the amazing coffee and sweets. I was so overwhelmingly pleased with the banana bread pudding that had to come back for more. Great strong coffee as well.
author: Andreia G.

description: Had an Americano this morning and it was just what I needed to try and get my day started. One of the best places to get coffee in the city, if not THE best in the Tenderloin.
author: David G.

description: I received their caramels as a gift once, and I thought they were amazing. The store itself is adorable, although it has little seating. Their coffee, caramels, and desserts were great! Would definitely come back here again.
author: Yvonne P.

description: Yay for Hookers! Incredible coffee. Awesome people work and own this adorable cafe. The caramels I'm told are amazing, being vegan I haven't tried them myself but every person that visits me freaks out about them. I actually send them to all my family members through out the year to bring them a little joy from Sf. Don't miss this excellent gem of a cafe in the heart of the city.
author: Eryn L.

description: Was in San Francisco for work and yelp steered me here. Came back for a second visit. Amazing. Espresso, bread budding salted caramel. Wow.
author: Jim D.

description:
Given the proximity of the place (less than a block from our apartment), its ambience, the quality of its offerings, the amiability of the owner and his help; this should be my favorite coffee house, and not just my favorite in San Francisco, but anywhere I've been.   

Quite frankly?  Can We Talk?  

I can't stand their coffee.  

My partner, the guy who drinks instant when camping (yecch) threw his out.  I'd never seen him dump coffee before. And that was after more than a month of regular visits.  We tried...

But coffee, like wine, is subjective;  one person's swill is another person's nectar, and a lot of people seem to have no issue with their coffee, so that's all I'll say.

I gave this place four stars because everything else is so well done.  There are lots of coffee houses in San Francisco, even if our district can't seem to get any good ones; either the decor sucks, or the owner is depressing (and in one place it's both), or it just has the wrong vibe, but few have put so much effort into the aesthetics of the place ("Sugar" on Geary comes to mind) as Hookers Sweets, while still maintaining the quality of the food (if not the...okay, I said I'd drop it, I'll drop it).

When I go out of town I come here for the salted caramels, as part of the "Taste Of San Francisco" locally made foodstuffs I take as gifts for those we're visiting.

So, while I now brew my own coffee at home, I'd still recommend this place if you're in the area.  Enthusiastically.
author: Paul T.

description: Effin ridiculous. And by ridiculous I mean ridiculously amazing. I've only had the bread pudding and it's delicious. Definitely a must try if you have a sweet tooth. The shop itself is adorable and the people that work there (maybe one is the owner?) are very nice. If they were in walking distance I'd probably have bread pudding everyday for lunch. Fortunately for my waist they are not.
author: Holly E.

description: I love sweets. I am not a caramel fan but I have to say this place puts crack in every batch. I found them at bi-rite and after sharing my nut caramels with a few friends I had to find the establishment of these amazing delights. Hands down the nut chews and coconut chews are the best the coconut nut caramel taste like a summer sun tan. I actually enjoy these so much that once I accidentally spilled them on to the TL side walk and street. My precious caramels were on the city street right next too dog poo and I normally would never ever ever pick them up but I couldn't let these babies go and had to pick them up obeying the 5 second rule of course. I shared them with friends and they enjoyed them with out knowing this little secret. They are really that good.
author: Christian A.

description:
Very cool little cafe tucked away on a mostly residential street in the Tender Loin. 
Sight glass coffee, and french press at that! Great Espresso drinks. Organic dairy products. On par with Blue Bottle, and Ritual.
friendly service. please note, French press takes a few minutes, so please be patient. 
And the most amazing Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip cookie I HAVE EVER had! 
Looking forward to trying out he other delicacies.
author: Kelle K.

description: I love you Max & your sweets! Max is a super sweet guy who eased me into caramels. I'm not a big fan nor did I realize how complicated caramels could be but everything that came out of his mouth made me want to get all the sweets. I got the original salted caramel, a espresso one and the PARTY GIRL which was AH-mazing!! And a cookie :) thank you for making my 5 pounds heavier but I'll be back fosho :)
author: J C.

description:
I don't drink coffee anymore.  I just can't handle it.  My stomach is a delicate fragile lotus blossom.  But that doesn't mean it understands why I've stopped imbibing the siren caffeine.  Lou and I came here after a soup and noodles lunch.  He wanted coffee and a sweet, I wanted a pony.

They have dark chocolate covered salted caramels here.  The pieces were irregular and on the small side.  The price said $2.  Luckily it came with 2 pieces.  Still small.  I'm planning on making these in a week to give as presents.  These were soft and creamy.  Not chewy or tacky.  Billowy, waiting to be released from the robe of organic free trade sustainable local chocolate.  

The Americano Lou ordered was SO STRONG that it made my stomach curdle.  Strong is not the correct word.  FRAGRANT.  or maybe flagrant.  It was so coffee-coffee that inhaling the ether of steam as it flowed upwind to where I sat on a stool gave me the jolt of stimulation.  Lou's cookie was ok, except it had peanuts in it.  I'm allergic to peanuts, Lou.  But I ate a bite anyway.  Oh boy.  Now my throat is a bit itchy.  twitch twitch.
author: Christina C.

description:
I love Hooker's!!!

Great coffee, awesome chocolate treats and you gotta try the bread pudding, the best I've ever had!

Best coffee shop in the TL hands down!
author: Emilio G.

description:
For about a year now, the steampunks and I have been talking about how there needs to be a steampunk cafe in San Francisco. We've made plans to try to build one, but nobody has the funding so it's still on the drawing board. This place is a little bit too small and specialized to fit our needs (a couple dozen folks gathering once a week to talk about gadgetry and corsets), but it gives me hope that something a little larger might spring up in the near future. 

As for the place itself, it's got a wonderful old-world feel to it and sells some of the best caramels I've ever wrapped my lips around. If you're wandering the 'Loin and have a craving for sweets, I highly recommend Hooker's.
author: Kathleen P.

description: yum, yum, YUM!! These are some of the best caramels i've ever had. Since everyone said the bread pudding was sooooo good, i am definitely going back to get some......Along with some more plain old salted caramels. ; )
author: Erica S.

description:
I know what you're thinking.  Since when did Hitarho open her own shop??!  

No, no- these aren't MY sweet treats.  I gave up that life.   If you think you saw me it's an imposter.  An imposter I say! 

These treats, are the real deal Holyfield though.  Dark chocolate covered caramel w/sea salt.....mmm....I have it bad for salty-sweet combos.  These hit the spot.  I bought 3 in a cutesy box.

And the bread pudding?!?  Sitting at the table, I tapped/stomped my feet while I ate it (think She's a Maniac/Flashdance scene) cuz it was so good.  Perfectly baked to a crisp on top, but so thick to the slice, and the caramel sauce was TDF.

Would love to try some caramel corn and chocolate banana bread pudding next time.  I'll be back.  See you there!
author: Rho T.

description:
Top 3 ways to tell you're at a Hipster joint
1. All the men are wearing skinny jeans
2. It takes them ten minutes to make one cup of coffee
3. Kitschy digs

I'm so happy hooker's chocolate opened their own place so I can have their chocolate all the time. Just got chocolate this visit but will be back to try all their other goodies.
author: Sophia C.

description:
This place sells some of the best chocolate anywhere but what they are famous for is the saltes caramel they sell. It is all handmade and is absolutely delightful. You can get it fully covered in chocolate or only part dipped. Despite its location in the dangerous Tenderloin area, I cannot recommend highly enough a trip here during the dailight hours.
Another SF must visit
author: deCabbit

description: What can I say but WOW!!!  These are the best caramels I have ever tasted !! Not only are the flavors FUN, but the size of these babies is awesome !! enough to let someone have a bite, and still get my caramel on !!!!  The folks at Hookers are not only experts  at making caramels, they are super nice to boot !!!   You won't be able to eat just one !!! YUM
author: Mary M.

description:
Never been here, but yesterday the boss was nice enough to leave me a box of chocolates on my desk. Knowing that I don't care for sweets he brought me some dark chocolate because I can't turn that down. 
It was heaven! who would have ever thought, that sea salt would taste so good on a chocolate?!!! 

HEAVEN!! Everyone in my family is a bunch of Dark Chocolate monsters, thank you Hooker's for allowing me to find the perfect Christmas gift for extended family. (and its only August!) 

Hookers = Heaven
author: Anna P.

description: My friend lives across the street from Hooker's and from time to time I receive a box of his sweet treats and when I do...I jump up and down and do a lil dance, make a lil noise....and I get down that night...on those caramels.  These are hands down the best caramels I have ever tasted.  They melt in your mouth....melt people!!  They are so creamy and buttery and mixed with the sea salt on top and chocolate (original caramel)....it's like heaven on earth.  I'm hoping that I can actually make it into his shop so I can try other of the treats I see on Hooker's FB page. Yes, I am a Hooker's stalker! But seriously you should see the posts of their breading puddings and cookies.  Yes, I'm a bit obsessed.  If you are in their area, do yourself a favor and stop in.  Don't be afraid of the hood either.  It's not as bad as people think.  Share a caramel when you walk out and you'll probably make a friend for life.
author: Natacha M.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood and found my sight glass coffee. Add a tasty bread pudding with locally sourced ingredients and I can start to see more of this place in my future.
author: James H.

description: Best bread pudding and it's a new one everyday.....a little too much caramel on top but still suuuuuper delicious. Love the coffee too, very good and strong. To sum up my mornings at Hookers I'll quote the guy behind the counter "Espresso and bread pudding....breakfast of champions."
author: Devin S.

description: Amazing Latte.  The sweets are perfection.  An OASIS in the neighborhood!
author: Eric S. R.

description:
I sooo wanted to love this place. And I did!

Amazing coffee, amazing treats, amazing people, amazing amazing.

Yo, folks. Stop sucking down sugar-infused drinks from Starbucks made by people who don't know steaming milk from taking a dump. Support excellent, authentic coffee shops like Hooker's. Once you do, you'll understand why.

Square.
author: Victor S.

description: Finally got to come here before they closed. I'm not really a big fan of caramel, but Hooker's sea-salted dark chocolate covered caramel? SO GOOD. I need to buy a bunch next time. super cute store and friendly staff - wish they didn't close at 4 !
author: Lily Z.

description:
Great local coffee and sublime sweets = a terrific combo.

I'm hooked on the mocha at Sightglass Coffee and was recently swooning over the wonderfully bitter yet smooth chocolate that is used in their mocha and was told that there's more where that comes from at the newly opened Hooker's Sweet Treats.

Hooker's Sweet Treats is a oasis in the midst of the TL. The space itself is inviting and has been lovingly decorated. I love the bank bag upholstery job on the chairs. Clever and functional. 

I was disappointed to discover that they don't sell that addictive chocolate sauce by the jar and it's more of a coffee joint than a sweet shop, however, the bread pudding with caramel sauce was amazing and how can you go wrong with a Sightglass Coffee chaser? 

I'm hopeful that the chocolate sauce for which I covet is offered by the jar in the near future.
author: Lee H.

description:
I give you five stars because I am exceptionally excited about a new coffee joint in my hood. I love good coffee, but I hate hungover bike rides to four barrel, so Hooker's is a fantastic idea. My only compliant: will you please consider extending your weeknight hours? Possibly closer to 8 if the market is there. I'm unfortunately a commuter at this point, and leave before 8am and arrive back after 6pm so I'm totes missin out on your fabulous treats and you're missing out on my coffee loving and BREAD PUDDING!!!! WOOT!!! spending obsession. 

I'm all for negotiating our relationship, hookers. 

ciao!
author: Tim L.

description:
It's been about what, 4 years since Bi-Rite Creamery popularized the combination of salt and caramel?  It's now fairly common as an upscale ice cream, in cookies and in a mash-up with another recent food trend, on cupcakes.  If I had eaten a plain old salted caramel before having one at Hooker's, it must not have been a memorable experience.

But Hooker's salted caramel is nothing short of perfection, balancing the sweet and bitter of softly pliable caramel and a delicate dark chocolate coating with the playfully light bite of a few flakes of salt.  This is a caramel you can eat without fear of losing a filling (I don't have any) or a tooth (I have plenty).  At $2 a hit, they are expensive as a confection, but affordable as a luxury product.

Similar care was taken with the $3 peanut-butterscotch cookie.  It too balanced sweet with salt, soft cookie with sticky butterscotch and crunchy peanuts.  Again, it's a bit expensive if you have a daily fix, but priced right or an occasional indulgence.

Hooker's also does a commendable job with the coffee, using Sightglass coffee roasted not even one mile away.

Finally, Hookers makes good use of a small space.  It looks very up-to-date San Francisco meaning it is old-timey in that vintage hip sort of way, yet still feels comfortable.
author: Suo L.

description:
These caramels are the best I've ever had. YUM!

Can't wait to go back (ahem, tomorrow) for some caramel corn and bread pudding.
author: Alicia C.

description:
Wow...I would have used OMG but it's already been used enough! These things are AMAZING!!

Got 1 of the chocolate-covered salted caramel & 1 of the salted caramel with a chocolate bottom layer. They were delicious! 

The mouthfeel is 1 of a kind. The chocolate melts in your mouth as you chew the caramel which isn't overly chewy & doesn't stick in your teeth. The salt on top is a small portion but you don't need a ton b/c they are large flakes & have big flavor. The combo of nuts is divine & altogether they make a dessert that you should "treat" yourself to much more often than that bag of potato chips. 

There's a reason there are so many 4-5 star reviews of this place. So glad they're in my neighborhood! Too bad they're not open on Sunday...maybe I should take a star away for that...nah!
author: Marissa H.

description: Love me some HOOKERS!!!! I'm not a coffee but adore their espressos, all carmels, treats and staff. Just a incredible place. It's small, sweet and neat. I will always love these HOOKERS.
author: Cook E M.

description:
MORRRRRRRRE SALT! Oh my heavens the salted caramels are amazingly-tasty treats. I bought myself a tiny box of three to celebrate for my birthday, and they were so mouth-wateringly good I had to go back and buy the big box!

Oh heavens they're delicious. The texture is exactly right, just firm enough not to ooze at room temp. 

If you go to Sightglass Coffee, be sure to try Hooker's Mocha as well - a dark chocolate ganache spooned into your latte will have you queueing up for a second cup, guaranteed.

Wish we had more than 5 stars :)
author: SisterMable S.

description: I was NEVER into dark chocolate until I had a Hooker's Dark Chocolate Sea Salt Caramel. When I was introduced to it, I immediately turned it down for it was dark chocolate, sea salt, and caramel. I couldn't imagine that combination be any where near good! But once I bit into it, it all made perfect sense. Mmmm..the smooth sweet caramel mingling with the sea salt that really complimented the creamy decadent dark chocolate....all inticing my taste buds....yum!!! Ahhhh...they are pricey for a little piece of heaven. $2 for one square, surely this is a place you would go to treat yourself for a hard days work. Can't afford this stuff everyday with the amount of money I make. Nonetheless, undeniably the best spot to get sea salted caramels in the city!
author: Fran M.

description: The chocolate was mediocre at best. Pretentious to the max with a rude cashier. No wifi, you can't have a conversation with out getting dirty looks. Oh and if chocolates are 2 dollars each, what makes you think that I'll think that getting 3 for 7 dollars is deal.
author: Deenie J.

description: IMHO, Hooker's is known for its caramel. I got a caramel pecan cookie here once and have been hooked since. It's no surprise that they are know as hooker's sweet treats. The cookie is fresh and the caramel is rich and dense... so for all you caramel lovers out there, please make this a must-try spot to satisfy your sweet tooth.
author: Cassy H.

description: Don't let the smell outside fool you. You didn't step in anything. It's just the smell of the Loin especially in the morning. This place feels like a cozy cottage with treats of the legal variety in the form of their incredible caramels. They also make cookies and other baked goods which are great. Farm Table is right around the corner, so if you're in the area for whatever reason (real hookers, crack, etc.) be sure to check out these two places, your stomach, and possibly your Loin will also thank you.
author: Mike C.

description:
This place is really really greaf!!! I just love the Mocha that I got! It was made with organic milk ( that's a standard here)! It was way better then starbucks, what a real mocha should be! Sweet but not overloaded a d still balanced ( they use there own chocolate for the mocha as well)!

I also got one of the salted carmals and it was uber amazing! Just the perfect balance of sweet and salty!! 

I can't wait to go back and try the breac pudding, it's next on my list! So glad to call this my new coffee spot!!!
author: Noelle L.

description: Brad pudding yummy! And the change the flavors all the time! Even though the neighborhood is a tad bit sketchy the dessert more than makes up for it!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
if you didn't know this place existed you'd walk right past it and never know it was there. actually, i take that back. if you didn't know it existed you would never even walk past it because what the hell are you doing in that neck of the woods with no destination? the tenderloin is no place to be without good reason. 

the caramels, covered in dark chocolate and sprinkled with sea salt were good, however i'd prefer it if the caramel itself was salted as well. the bread pudding was tasty and moist and the caramel sauce was super sweet.
author: Regina C.

description:
uhh LOVE.

when my friend and I first visited here, she was going nuts about how cute the place is.  The teas are good (I'm not a huge coffee person so can't say much to that).  We've tried the bread pudding but I actually like the sea salt caramel chocolate and this pecan cookie thing better.  The service is wonderful.  I love the owner! My friend and I basically try to come here once a week to "study" aka talk with our books open.
author: Christine B.

description:
I so wanted to love this place. I have the biggest sweet-tooth in the world and have a special place in my heart for caramel. 

My experience was very unpleasant and did not make me want to recommend this place to anyone. In fact, this is my first negative review. 

Customer service was definitely lacking! Unfortunately, this place has a $20 minimum for credit card transactions. Being that this was my first time, I wasn't aware of this fact and didn't have any cash. The employee was beyond rude and was very insulting. I have never seen a $20 minimum. If the minimum was $10, I may have bought an extra carmel. I apologized because I wasn't aware of this fact but the employee was still being abrasive. 

Finally, they did take my credit card. Customer service is something I take very seriously. I will admit the caramel was tasty, but I will never be a customer again. 

**The gentlemen taking my order was very pleasant it was the other employee.
author: Amy V.

description: First of all, the owner, I think his name is David, cleans his own windows. We're talking about personal attention to details and you'll find it in every nook and corner of the cafe and cookies. You'll be treated to a wonderful space, great treats, good coffee and interesting people and in and out of the cafe. Nice going Hookers!
author: Andrea Y.

description: I could drink the bourbon-caramel sauce they pour over the bread pudding all day long. The little salted caramel candies are amazing. My Friday sweet tooth is so very satisfied!
author: Lynn M.

description: Who are these reviewers? where am i?! there is seriously a place called "hookers" in the Tenderloin that serves fancy pastries? what happened to the old neighborhood full of real people, great food, queer bars, and dive bars? so strange.
author: Hank T.

description: The space is great, the people who work there are incredibly nice and cute, the hours are pretty good, and the caramels are excellent - but I still just don't think they're $20 for 10, $7 for 3 excellent. And while salty and sweet is a hard combination to beat, the caramel praline bars sort of ended up beating that flavor to death for me. But I'm disappointed they don't seem to have the caramel corn around any more, so how tired of that combo can I really be?
author: Lisa K.

description:
Came here for an afternoon delight and enjoyed it. I felt like I was at the general store from Oregon Trail, except with cooler music and a cute boy at the counter. Both he and the owner were very helpful and engaging, which compensated for the high prices and cash-only policy. Tried my friend's peanut butter cookie, which looked like a dehydrated Blondie bar, but surprisingly turned out delicious: chewy with delicately flaky surface, mellow yet flavorfully nutty without tasting like junk food. I purchased their chocolate covered salted caramels; liked how they were smoother rather than tackier, thus lending the salty/sweet contrast a real emulsifying and full-bodied quality. 

Boyfriend found a used tampon at the foot of the entrance which turned him off to the place, but I'd take the hop for more Hooker treats.
author: Nicole L.

description:
First time coming in today, but I'm proud to say that it's the first coffee shop to meet all my criteria of an awesome coffee shop.  

The French press is good, the atmosphere's amazing, music's great, AND the workers are really nice.  Free delicious caramel sample taken to us as we sat, and they've had real conversations with everyone who's come I'm so far.  Top notch, hands down.
author: Jon O.

description:
OMG, the Salted Chocolate-Covered Caramels are amazing! Sweet, salty, and subtle. A must get for anyone's first time to Hookers. Also, the box of 3 or 10 make a great gift.

As for coffee, they have delicious french press made to order and the barista makes a great cappuccino.
author: Tevy D.

description: Hooker's is a killer little coffee shop with a whole lotta style, and right in the heart of the ole Tenderoni.  I want to say that these guys are helping to contribute to the "Tenderloin Renaissance", but that would mean that the Loin was once cool, which it's never been.  More appropriately, Hooker's is one of the Tenderloin Pioneers, as more and more unique little shops and bars open up and give people a better reason to come here than just an STD or crack cocaine.
author: Ted T.

description: I really wasn't expecting the sweet treats to be as delicious and well-crafted as they were. I tried the three different caramels they had. Caramels are my favorite, and usually places do them too hard. These were made just right. The consistency not of the "stick-to-your-teeth" variety of caramels so often found, but rather so soft and delectably chewy. I used to date a guy who made old-fashioned chocolates and caramels, and his caramels really were the best I've ever had.  I stopped missing him a long time ago--apparently I won't have to miss his candy anymore, either.
author: Jille E.

description:
It was the weekend. It was early I was up and wanted coffee. I had been told about Hooker's and was excited to sample their wares.

I came to the door...but it was locked! I looked around assuming I had made some pre-coffee morning mistake and was trying to enter a door that lead to the needle exchange clinic the tenderloin is notorious for! But no. I could see through the window that there was light and movement inside the establishment.

I tried the door again, desperate for caffeine on this cold unwelcoming morning, but it would not yield. I was confounded and confused till magically the door was opened by an angel who informed me that the shop was not open till 10am. It was 9:30. They were kind enough to take me in, however, and make me a delicious cup of french pressed coffee.

It was transcendent as were their delightful treats.

I had a chocolate covered macaroon that was a gift from the heavens. You can't go wrong with the place.

Sweethearts and sweet treats!
author: Jack R.

description:
You can tell someone put a lot of thought into the look of this place! But obviously, that is not as important as the taste! They have only a few items on the menu but just looking at it made my mouth water. 
Bread pudding? Caramel & Praline cookies? Yes please! The cookies had a hint of salt and the sweet/salty combo were making my tongue dance. I forget what the bread pudding was made of but the guy asked us if we wanted the caramel sauce on it or on the side. As if he needed to ask! Pour that sauce, man! It was very, very sweet. I know it did have bits of apple and banana. My teeth protested a little but my taste buds definitely appreciated it.  
It would have been FANTASTIC with coffee but I'm too sensitive to caffeine to have any. But wow! If you are lucky enough to drink coffee at all times of the day, come here and order some sweets to go with it! You're welcome!
author: Amanda W.

description: I learned about this cute little treat shop on the Cooking Channel on "Unique Sweets." If its on the Cooking Channel, then I have to check it out. I ordered the original salted carmel and the peanut butter chocolate chip cookie. They were both delicious, oh my gosh. I almost turned around and went back to the store, but I remember self-control. However, I will be going back for some more.
author: Baseemah R.

description: very specialized place.  got the Brothers Not Lovers caramel (sea salted chocolate espresso caramel covered in dark chocolate and topped with pistachios).  definitely good.  perfect bites of soft salty sweet caramel.  should make a great artisan gift.
author: Rob C.

description:
Homemade chocolate granache inside my coffee, please sir may I have some more?! I was licking the inside of the cup.  
The mocha is the way to go, it's not too sweet like the typical powdery sugary stuff at other coffee shops.  Hooker uses bittersweet chocolate, sightglass  coffee and steamed strauss family milk. Delicious treat! 
Can't wait to go back with an appetite for cheddar biscuits, bread pudding, and cookies!
Thanks for coming to my hood.
author: Kimmy C.

description:
It's great to have a coffee/sweet treats shop half a block away.  Unfortunately, I'm at work most of the time they're open.  

The spiced iced coffee is delicious!
author: Sergio R.

description:
I love hookers! And chocolate. And coffee. 
Really, they're awesome. 
Thank god I can now find ALL of these things in the TL.
And of such amazing quality...
...except for maybe the former.
author: Adrienne F.

description:
Hookers is a new front-runner in artisan coffee in the Lower Nob Hill Area. Sadly, Lower Nob Hill is not blessed with a plethora of roasteries like the Mission District is but, thanks to this magnetic new start up, we've got one of the strongest players in the game right here in our own quaint little area. 

The coffee and espresso is roasted by the amazing, and amazingly new, head honcho of master coffee in the city: Sightglass Coffee. Always expertly prepared by Hookers's beautiful/handsome baristas who know how to make a latte into a piece of art...even if you're taking it ToGo, as I often do.

The man responsible for this new gem of a location definitely knows what he's doing, especially when it comes to his "sweet treats". I thought his sea-salted, chocolate covered caramels were the best thing under the sun, with its soft and rich texture and its savory saltiness... But then, this morning, my boyfriend brought me what he's cookin up now, his latest creation: Praline Caramel Cookies - OUT OF THIS WORLD DELICIOUS. Seriously.

Hooker's Sweet Treats is: Coffee and Hand-made treats done properly by people you like.

It won't be long before its the most popular place in the area, so you might as well not try to fight it, like you did Gaga.
author: Gilbert B.

description: Only 1 visit, heard about them from Sightglass coffee which features Hookers chocolate in their mocha (excellent). Quality chocolate caramel treats here. Had one in the store and bought a box for friends at home, lucky bastards. The guys working were great, friendly and helpful. Definitely recommended!
author: Brandi H.

description: A place named Hooker's in the heart of the Tenderloin that makes a truly excellent cappuccino....5 STARS.
author: A L.

description:
I LOVE this place. It's a tiny little gem that just opened up in my hood. 
A great spot where you can sit and enjoy coffee for two served up by some nice folks and split some hot bread pudding drenched in the best caramel sauce I've ever tasted. 
Need a last min gift? Pick up a box of salted chocolate caramels that are to die for.
author: sarah d.

description:
By sheer default (intriguing business name don't you think?), I knew that I wanted to see what Hooker's Sweet Treats was offering. 

It was quick and painless. I walked in, saw what I wanted, asked how much and how long it would last. "Five minutes, shorter if you take it all at once. I'll even give you a bigger one..." Slightly taken aback, I quickly realized they were referring the size of the caramel.

The dark chocolate covered caramels topped with sea salt was perfectly balanced. The bitterness of the chocolate was just right and offset the sweetness of the caramel in harmony with the sea salt. 

The price was right and I was completely satisfied. I would suggest that everyone pay Hooker's a visit for a sweet treat.
author: Mark Y.

description: The Bread Pudding w/caramel sauce, simply put "KNOCKED MY SOCKS OFF"
author: Freddie L.

description:
French press coffee + triple fruit bread pudding + super friendly service + country kitsch atmosphere = perfect place to caffeinate and enjoy a sweet treat on a late Saturday morning. 

I'll be back to try the caramels.
author: Robyn M.

description:
We residents of lower Hyde Street are happier people because of this lovely, delicious little cafe.  The caramels, cookies, and bisquits are absolutely incredible (we like to stop by early in the morning, when some of the baked goods are still warm).  The coffee is great, and the staff are warm, friendly people. It's just a wonderful, wonderful place.

Please give this great little business the support it deserves. Give it a try next time you're in the neighborhood.
author: Christina R.

description: The staff, the owner, and the candy is all that.  I love what David is doing.  Great job and thanks for lifting the bar in the hood.
author: Joe D.

description: I can't believe I haven't reviewed Hooker's yet! I've been coming here for about 2 years now as they are located only two blocks from where I work. Hooker's is a little gem tucked away in the Loin and I'm actually glad 1) it keeps the hipsters away and 2) it's like a secret between the Tenderloin and I. They used to make the best ginger/caramel popcorn but stopped. Their bread pudding is amazing as well their cookies and salted caramels (their treats are a bit pricey but it's made on site so well worth it) HOWEVER you should come in early as all the treats are usually gone by the afternoon. I love, love, love their coffee drinks; their iced spicy coffee is a must try but did give me a tummy ache (too strong for me).  The owner is wonderful and supports everything we do (I work at an after school program nearby).
author: selina n.

description: dude my family is hooked on there treats. folks are friendly and engaging. Just a warm feeling when you walk in...once you try their stuff you'll keep coming back...
author: Daniel M.

description: Hooker's salted caramels are so yummy that I had bought some to bring home to my friends and I ended up eating almost all of them. Its in a very tiny coffee shop in the tenderloin and if you walk too quickly you will miss it. I was using my GPS on my phone and had to back track a couple steps because if you blink you will pass right by. I'm so glad they do mail order!
author: Christy T.

description: Salted caramel chocolate treat is so delicious!
author: Tanasan S.

description:
This is my sweet spot in the City. Brought 2 out of towners for a client meeting and this place helped sealed the deal. 

Very nice place, and a great spot to walk from City Center or Union Square!
author: C L.

description:
There simply aren't words to describe the experience of eating the amazing sea salted dark chocolate covered caramels created by "Hooker", of Hooker's Sweet Treats.  You're not just eating chocolate, you are consuming a piece of heaven.  With each and every bite, your mouth is delivered a bit of rich chocolate, caramel that is the perfect taste (sweet, but not too sweet) and texture (doesn't stick all over your teeth) and the sea salt on top kicks all the flavors up a notch.  I've made myself sick on these, they're so flippin' good.

If you can get your hands on the Orange Caramels, I HIGHLY recommend trying these as well.  Again the texture is perfection and the combination of the sweet caramel infused with orange is just about the the best thing ever!!!
author: J B.

description: REALLY??????????????  I can't believe how good the salted chocolate  was.  A perfect compliment to the perfect espresso.  Need atmosphere paying tribute to the early 1900s.  Service was excellent.  Will be back.  Very neat gift idea.
author: April M.

description: Delicious + adorable. The guys who work here are super friendly.
author: Anne T.

description: I only come to Hooker's with a friend who is willing to spend $3 for a cookie. Not me, thanks, because I live in the real world.  Everyone I know says EVERYTHING Hooker's makes is truly delicious...but the only reason I accompany my friend is because of the one cute guy that works there.  Now HE is a sweet treat.
author: Mr. G.

description:
The first time I passed by their dark exterior I had to make a comment

"Hookers on Hyde? I thought they just stuck to Larkin."

My walking companion made equally charming commentary as we passed a local middle aged resident shouting solicitations at cars between sips and slurps of her shiny goblet of King Cobra or Steel Reserve. Classy for a sunny afternoon.

But as charming as this dew of sundrops was, she didn't hold a candle to Hooker's itself. Upon entering the dark exterior opens up to a small, warm, rustic but homey interior. I don't know why but I was instantly feeling a Little House on the Prarie vibe in a great way. A large dark wood table flanks the left side of the cafe and the menu is simply displayed in the corner of both the front window and to the right of the cash register. A large chalk board to the upper left promotes the daily special. When I went there were cheese biscuits, caramel praline cookies and yes, bread pudding for offer. I was recovering from a long night of talking (not in a bad way) but was in high spirits. The cappucino I got was fantastic, the right balance between frothy and hot. A salted caramel added to my perk me up-pick my up, holding the attention of my taste buds. I slurped that bad boy rather than chew until I was all but slobbering caramely goodness. See I can be classy too!

The happy warming feeling inside was matched by mellow mood music and a nice guy behind the counter who made me my tasty beverage. He expertly made my drink, paying attention to detail while remaining friendly and charming with those of us indulging in the pleasures of Hooker's. The vibe is mellow like the library and unpretentious. Definitely a place to consider if you enjoy "me time" with your coffee. Maybe a tad bit pricey for an everyday excursion but just like people who indulge in the other kind of hooker in the neighborhood sometimes you just have to treat yourself to the talents and treats that someone new has to offer. Cheers.
author: Veronica G.

description: small cafe with just a few seats in a gritty area.  Sightglass coffee and an assortment of salted chocolate carmels.  Great gift idea.
author: around town e.

description: I had the mocha and while it was good, I've had much better for a more reasonable price. I wasn't feeling the atmosphere too much either, the only thing that I really enjoyed from Hooker's were the caramels.  But even the candy was far from being worth the price . . . Sorry Hooker's :(
author: Beatriz A.

description: I learned about Hooker's through Yelp while searching for something different for Valentine's Day. What a great find! I went into the store to buy an assorted 10-pack of salted caramels. I also ended up buying a bread pudding to take home, and they gave me re-heating instructions. The men in the store were extremely friendly and helpful, and it was nice to watch them making each caramel one-by-one right there. Both the caramels and the bread pudding were amazing. They were also a bargain - $20 for a 10-pack, and the caramels are BIG! Plus they are completely scrumptious. We will absolutely go back again for our own consumption and for gifts for others.
author: K B.

description: Such a charming space! It's the kind of place you feel bad getting your coffee to-go. Delicious cheese biscuits and good french press -- unique, stout-like coffee. Next time I'm trying their salted caramels. Very friendly customer service.
author: Emily B.

description: Awesome and the owner is very cool. Had great coffee and chatted with neighbors.
author: Anna C.

description: I just bought the coconut-pineapple, blueberry bread pudding!, i know what your thinking, and yes it was delicious. i wish i tasted when it came out the oven, but by the time i had a bite, 5 hrs had gone by. it  was still delicious though.. the shop is uber cute and the salted caramel was divine.. best way to get a cavity. anyhow iff your in downtown san francisco, you might wanna walk down on hyde & check them out. it's kind of a sketchy neighborhood but i guess that's downtown sf for you!
author: Jocelyn C.

description: My husband and I discovered the wonders of Hooker's Sweet Treats shortly after they opened and have been devoted fans ever since.  When planning our wedding, we crossed our fingers that the shop made wedding favors and we were in luck!  We worked with David to customize the packaging for the favors and sent our guests home with delicious caramels.  We've been getting rave reviews from our guests ever since.  If you're looking for unique SF wedding (or everyday) treats check this place out!
author: Erica W.

description: Chocolate covered salted caramels...AMAZING.
author: Amy A.

description: Love the praline cookies, am addicted to the salted caramels. Cute little store front, friendly customers and sweet deliciousness. Mmmm...salted caramels
author: Hayesvalleygirl ..

description: the salted caramels and those SWEET CHEDDAR BISCUITS are so good!! it's a little bit pricey and not in the best area of town (luckily we were in town for a short visit and happened to stay in the apartment building right above the establishment) but definitely worth a try.  great service and the smell inside is just heavenly especially right at opening when all their baked goods are coming out fresh.
author: Jen K.

description: Awesome little place. I missed it the first time I walked by, but eventually found it (its the black awning on the east side of the street). The interior was small but homey and had a nice by-gone era vibe to it. the coffee was good, but the chocolates were amazing. I had the caramel and sea salt one, and it was one of the best I have ever tasted. Only downside: the crazy on the street outside yelling "its weed, not crack"
author: Cory H.

description: I don't give just anyone 5 stars. Whoa. These are the best. Really. This is *exactly* the kind of caramel I like the best, just like my parents make. Thick, chewy not sticky. And the dark chocolate on these is actually delicious, high quality tasty chocolate. And then the salt! Oh my! The salt! Wow. I've had other salted caramels that I've loved.. but these are firmly in first place for my favorites ever. Thank goodness I go to sightglass often!
author: Jessica S.

description: This cafe & sweet shop is a little San Francisco gem.  I found it accidently walking back to my car after doing some volunteer work.  I was just looking for a nice cup of coffee.  This place has some great coffee and some great small batch / artisan sweets.  Whoever is making the sweets is talented and has a lot of passion!  I had something wonderful made with caramel and nuts.  The salt on it was perfect and so tasty.  It went so well with the French press coffee I ordered.   The staff was friendly and happy and the shop decor is fun and hip.
author: Herman W.

description: Ahh sweet perfection in every way. The coffee's amazing the caramels are amazing and his cookies are amazing. I just wished he had tea and longer hours.
author: Catherine C.

description: Everything they offer is absolutely delicious. The right kind of new business is the area, too. Friendly, respectful, positive, yes, but after all, it's really about the coffee and the sweets and they are both SUPERAWESOME.
author: digiTED ..

description: Talk about an oasis in the middle of the Tenderloin. Tucked away on Hyde just before O'Farrell, this little coffee shop and dessert location is pure tranquility. Step in to soothing music, great staff behind the counter and great coffee. I can't wait to go back and grab some treats.
author: Rebecca D.

description: The chai tea latte was pretty strong, could be sweeter. The salted caramel is good but too pricey. Good experience I don't know if I would go back again though.
author: Anna H.

description: I came here with a friend, who recommended and also highly reviewed the place a week or so ago, and had a great expierience. friendly staff, the bread pudding was amazing (I don't even like caramel THAT much and ended up devouring mine). The chai i had was also tasty, will come back soon
author: Luis S.

description: Great coffee and WONDERFUL hand made sweets!! GO CHECK IT OUT.  And THIS is coming from someone who doesn't like sweets!
author: Ani N.

description: Their salted caramels send me into a weightless tailspin of heady goodness. Hot damn. Get them at the Perish Trust or now Sightglass Coffee.
author: casey c.

description: Bless you David, this place is great. Coffee is just what I need most mornings, if I get up that early. Sweet cheddar biscuit = heaven. The new Cran-Pear bread pudding is so nice I'm going to eat one in about 20 min (11.18.2010). The caramels are the perfect match of salt and sweet. Nice work.
author: C G.

description: I was extremely pleased with my visit to hookers sweet treats. The coffee is wonderful and the people there are great. I didn't know it was cash only and just had my card on me, but the owner was so kind and told me not to worry and just come back later to pay..you can't always find great customer service like that. Thank you for coming to the tenderloin Hookers!
author: nikki r.

description: So cute! The snacks here are amazing! So delish! I smoke a bowl and then go get there cherry bread pudding (that they make to order) and an espresso, which they serve with a shot of sparkling water to boot. Nice one! The ambiance in this place is so amazingly vintage it reminds me of restoration hardware, but more authentic. They usually have cute music playing and it doesn't hurt they have a cute super friendly guy who works here. Coolness in the TL? Yeee.
author: Chris T.

description: This place is dangerously close to my house. The coffee is deelish and the caramels are WONDERFUL. They have just the right amount of sweetness, a perfect combination of salty and sweet. I love the sea salt so much it would be amazing if it was all over them, but I do understand the restraint. Love. This. Place.
author: Madeline L.

description: yummy salted dark chocolate caramel was amazing. i am still thinking about them. thanks for sharing at Gfest yesterday ( i was at Mamas Empanada's truck)
author: Liz B.

description: The salted carmels are awesome. Waiting for a box to make their way to Canada right now!
author: susan c.

description: Location wise, it could be a lot better.  The salted caramel is THE BEST I have tasted by far.  Pure heaven!!   It's pretty pricey  but it's all handmade and the quality shows.    Bread pudding and caramel bourbon sauce is freakin awesome.
author: David M.

description: I thought I'd arrived at pb nirvana with their peanut butter and chocolate chip cookie. The cookie is thick and moist, and the dough has a rich  peanut flavor, punctuated by crisp whole peanuts, and plump chocolate chips. Mmmm.
author: Aiko S.

description: The most amazing bread pudding and salted caramels!! Will be back to try more from the menu. Support local small businesses!
author: Dana R.

description: Amazing coffee and out of this world caramels. No really, its like heaven. Chewy, but never stick caramel dipped in dark rich chocolate with a light sprinkling of sea salt.  This is a little gem in the Loin that deserves a visit. The interior space is incredibly sweet and welcoming, the folks from The Perish Trust helped make it what it is and it shows. Its small but bring a book and have a seat. You'll love enjoying and impeccable cup of coffee and a sweet treat is the awesome little space!
author: Jenny E.

description: We were lucky enough to stumble on this place just before they officially opened and they asked if they could try out some cappuccino and bread pudding on us!!  Awesome place.  Can't wait to go back!!
author: Karen B.

description: So happy to have finally had a chance to try Hooker's! I've had Sightglass coffee on many an occasion, but it's great to have some right in my 'hood, especially when it's so expertly prepared. Tasteful decor, bigger than Farm:Table, and the sweets are terrific.
author: Dido H.

description:
this place is a diamond in the ruff! 
no words can express how refreshing it is to see a place like this in a sea of so many businesses that don't really care about the customer or the product they are serving.
God bless you hooker! i am so glad to have this gem so close to where i live and I always look forward to popping in for some coffee and treats. 
everyone should experience this place at least once.
author: amar g.
